Este uno de los juegos que desde que salió he tenido muchas ganas de jugarlo, pero por diversas razones he terminarlo de jugarlo, poco más de diez años después de su salida. 

El juego está bien a pesar de sus fallos y sus tomas de decisiones un tanto extrañas y hasta cierto punto horribles, los controles a la hora de apuntar con un arma son horribles, la IA de los supervivientes te hace sangrar los ojos, mas aun cuando en ciertas zonas hay una cantidad de zombies que pasar sobre ellos y cuidar del o los supervivientes desesperante a niveles bíblicos.

En cierto momento del juego, recibes una serie de disparos por varias personas y no puedes salir ni moverte ni hacerte nada, porque Frank hace una pequeña animación al ser disparado, pero como hay muchos disparos no sales de esa animación y es muy frustrante y desesperante, sobre todo siendo de nivel bajo que tienes poca vida. 

Pero bueno fuera de todo esto, creo que el juego está muy bien, esta versión de pc viene con altas resoluciones y a 60 fps y siendo un juego de hace muchos años, supongo que se le puede “perdonar” ciertas cosas.  

en conclusión, recomiendo este juego, la historia esta bien, puedes hacer un poco lo que te salga de las balls y es muy rejugable.

40392129.review:
Dead Rising para PC é uma "Remasterização" do jogo de Xbox 360 de 2006, e para um port de PC, ficou muito bem feito, pelo menos na minha experiência não ouve nenhum erro na versão de PC, como bugs ou otimização.

É muito engraçado ver o povo reclamando da jogabilidade do jogo, sendo que esse é o mesmo povo que elogiava o jogo em 2006, e não é porque o jogo envelheceu mal, e sim porque o povo esqueceu como é jogar algo difícil, e não, não vou usar o meme do Dark Souls.

Sim a mira do jogo é horrível, mas lembrando que é uma mira de controle, eles podiam sim fazer uma mira melhor no PC, mas na minha opinião iria deixar muita coisa fácil. Jogar pela primeira vez com level 1, é algo frustrante, o Frank é muito lento e o dano dele é bem baixo, mas depois de zerar uma vez ou pegar level você vai poder jogar de novo e tentar fazer todas as missões. A interação com o cenário é incrível, você consegue brincar com literalmente tudo no shopping.

Agora o ponto que todo mundo reclama e tenho que concordar, Dead Rising nunca teve uma I.A boa, mas esse aqui ganha o prêmio da pior I.A feita para um jogo, não importa o level do seu personagem, sempre vai ser uma dor de cabeça resgatar os npcs.

Dead Rising 2 foi o primeiro que joguei da franquia, eu gostei tanto que comprei o 3, só que ele não me agradou tanto igual o 2, e quando lançou Dead Rising para PC em 2016, eu comprei e percebi que depois dele a franquia só foi caindo. Não que o 2 e 3 sejam jogos ruins, mas não chegam nem perto do carinho que tiveram para fazer o primeiro jogo.

Como por exemplo, o enredo do 1 é o melhor da franquia, o enredo do 2 é fraco com personagens nada marcantes, e o 3 tem personagens ok só que cheio de furos e desculpas ao longo do jogo. Dead Rising 1 fala sobre o consumo de carne dos americanos, que estavam consumindo muito rápido que não estava dando tempo dos animais nascerem, mas é melhor jogar para entender.

Eu prefiro a ambientação do Dead Rising 1 do que os outros pelo simples motivo de ser mais realista, e não é algo extravagante igual o 2. O tema de terror psicológico e drama ajuda a melhorar o enredo do jogo, um clima muito mais triste do que qualquer outro Dead Rising, até mesmo do que o 3, que só não é o mais dramático porque a história principal vira algo muito infantil em certas partes. Dead Rising 1 é o jogo com o enredo mais pesado de toda a franquia.

O jogo é difícil, e para muitos vai ter partes injustas, tempos nas missões, Psicopatas, e muita coisa vai aparecer até você chegar em algum final de Dead Rising. Mas é o mais bem feito de toda a franquia, porque depois daqui o jogo vai piorando aos poucos até chegar no Dead Rising 4 que todos sabemos como é "bom" aquele jogo.

40019617.review:
I love this game man. Ever since I downloaded the DR Demo off the Xbox 360 Marketplace I was hooked. The game has aged quite a bit but it still doesn't mean its hilariously fun. This game and Dead Rising 2 are probably the best ones in the series by far. This game can be very frustrating if its your first time playing but once you get the hang of the games mechanics you'll learn to enjoy it more especially on your second playthrough.

Pros
- Game looks good for being 10 years old
- Decent framerate even in highly populated areas. 1080p 60fps flawlessly.
- Lots of replayability. There are 6 endings you can get and 10+ psychopaths in total in the game and nearly half you can either choose to fight or not. There is also 50+ survivors you can save which can make for a great challenge. Not to mention the achievements which will give you some work to do for a while.
- Special items after getting achievements + beating the game. Not spoiling though.
- The soundtrack is great
- Game can be hilarious and pretty creepy sometimes, good mixture of both.
- You pretty much have to play the game over again twice to have a better experience and do things you haven't done in your first playthrough.
- Lots of weapons in this game to choose from even gun wise
- Lots of different attires to choose from
- You can do pretty much anything you wanna do in this game, the game doesn't force you to do the story. If you want to just fuck around do side missions and kill psychopaths, you can do that.
I could go on.

Cons
- The AI is fucking horrendous. Trying to get more than 5 survivors at a time into the safe room is living hell. Good luck when one of them manages to get caught in an endless zombie hit loop and is half their life bar in 10 seconds. I really wanted to die when I did the savior achievement and had to rescue every fucking survivor. A true challenge indeed.
- Bosses can be pretty stupid sometimes. For example Adam the Clown who is a boss in this game does a move where he can continously have you in the air with his chainsaws and do 5+ blocks of damage. Pretty fucking bullshit. Oh and that Carlito fight with the barrett 50 cal, enjoy that one first try lol
- Some achievements are a little grindy. You will find that doing achievements will unlock items for you in the next playthrough, but some are very grindy and just plain boring, one even making you grind killing zombies for a good two and a half hours. 
- The AI get a second spot on this list because they're just that bad, waypoints barely work at all.
- If you pick up 3 different types of books it makes Adams chainsaws (you get it after you kill him) work for like 3000+ hits. Makes the game pretty dull tbh. Also the fact they respawn when you leave the area makes it pretty op. It kills psychopaths in like 2-3 hits and 2 chainsaws could last you the entire game without any trouble. You can obviously choose to ignore this and not use it but the fact its in the game is kinda stupid.

Overall; amazing game. Buy it.

39989713.review:
Dead Rising is a hard title to recommand to anyone, at least for me. In one side, the game is extremely fun to play, but it is extremely challenging. This game will kick your butt, multiple times, but it's also hard to not stop playing. 

You play as Frank West, a journalist that travels to Williamette, Colorado for a new story, only to be infested by zombies. Frank lands on top of Willamette's Mall rooftop and instructs his pilot to pick him up in 72 hours. What happens next is up to you.

Dead Rising doesn't take itself too seriously, and that's a good thing. Dead Rising also does a good job with its sandbox enviroment. Everything is a weapon, and how you want to go about objectives is all on you. You can also travel to different parts of the mall, go inside most stores, and dress up Frank for no reason. Frank can also use his camera to photograph anything, giving you PP points, a form of XP points. 

Frank can also encounter survivors along his trip, and it's up to you to lead them to saftey. However, the AI in this game is horrendous, and the time limit you have to try to save this one or multiple survivors is a stressful, frustrating experience. The boss battles are intense and challenging, but not impossible. 

There's a lot of things i wouldn't want to talk about in this review, as it's best played without knowing things in advance.

Do I recommand this game? It depends on what you are looking for.
 
[*]Are you looking for a tough game that doesn't take itself too seriously? [b]Buy it.[/b]
[*]Are you looking for a zombie sandbox game? [b]Buy it.[/b]
[*]Are you looking for a hand holding sandbox game? [b]Don't buy it.[/b]

If you are going to buy it, get ready to be defeated multiple times, but be prepared to have a fun time. 
[b]Now stopping wasting time, chop 'till you drop![/b]

39945976.review:
Dead Rising is a certified classic. I never got around to playing it due to the lack of a PC port, but when they remastered the game for the Xbox One and PS4 for the game's 10th anniversary, they graced us with a PC port, so I finally got to experience it, and it was quite good.

[h1]Story[/h1]
You are Frank West, a freelance photographer always trying to find the next big story. After hearing about something big going down in Willamette, Colorado, Frank hires a private helo pilot to fly him in after all the entrances to the city have been blocked off by the military. After seeing people fighting in the streets, he assumes it's a riot, and orders the pilot to drop him off at the rooftop of the mall, and to come back for him in 3 days. After venturing inside, he quickly finds out that it's a zombie outbreak, and he sets out to find out why the zombie outbreak occured, along with saving anyone he can find.

[h1]Positives[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Great remaster.[/b] This game was older, so it got a refresh for the PC release, and it's a great port. I never crashed once, never dropped a single frame, and never ran into any bugs or glitches. One glitch I know of is almost getting breached out of bounds during a boss fight cause I was in an awkward position. Graphics are clean and solid; I have no complaints at all. MSAA, Borderless Windowed, and uncapped framerate sweeten the deal. Load times are also insanely fast. Load screens never last more than 3 seconds on my PC, and I had this game installed on a hard drive.
[*][b]Solid story with side missions.[/b] Game's story is solid. It's full of plot twists, and has a bunch of varied characters that are all great in their own ways. During some downtime from the story, you can do side missions, which include killing psychopaths or saving survivors.
[*][b]Crazy gameplay.[/b] You're trapped in a mall with hundreds of zombies everywhere. You'll be running through crowds of zombies constantly, which can be super frustrating, but also super fun. Boss fights are all different and super insanely fun.
[*][b]RGB-esque leveling system.[/b] During the rescue of survivors or slaughter of psychopaths, you earn PP, which levels you up to gain useful stats such as Attack Damage, inventory space, health, and even running speed.
[*][b]Great world.[/b] The mall is full of different shops for you to change clothes or gather weapons. Keep an eye out for the gun shop for some sweet firearms, or the medieval shop for some swords and battleaxes.
[*][b]Post-game goodies.[/b] After you beat the main story, called 72-Hour mode, you unlock Overtime mode, which is kinda like a post-game story after the main story. You also unlock Infinity mode, which is a new gamemode altogether and is based around how long you can survive.
[/list]

[h1]Mixed[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Not easy at the start.[/b] For newcomers such as myself, the game has a steep difficulty hill before you become a zombie slaughterhouse. You can't hold many items; you can't do any evasive moves, and most of the pathways are gated off until you progress through the story. But, similar to Dying Light, the game gets much better once you level up and get yourself familar with the game.
[/list]

[h1]Negatives[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]Super frustrating sometimes.[/b] People who hate this game usually say this is why. The game has difficulty spikes that can make you rage like hell (I'll admit it made me rage a few times), such as being hit and not being able to dodge the next attack fast enough cause some animations are a million seconds long, or how zombies will still grapple you even though you're jumping away from them, causing you to lose some of the relatively limited health you have, or how some bosses are super hard to beat, or they have some sort of insane advantage towards you, [spoiler]such as the Isabela fight with her on a motorcycle or the three convicts on the military humvee with a .50 cal machine gun.[/spoiler] Saving survivors is almost impossible sometimes, with them always getting grappled, and never breaking the grasp themselves, so you have to always go back for them. Sometimes, you can't save survivors due to the time limit you have, which sometimes forces you to leave survivors behind to die since they're so freaking slow. All of this gets super annoying, and will probably turn some people off.
[/list]

[h1]Summary[/h1]
Aside from the negatives and mixed feelings, the game is great, and worth your time. It's a fun and classic zombie game with a great story, great character, and overall a great experience. If you haven't played Dead Rising at all, I would recommend starting with the second game (You don't need to play this game. DR1 and DR2 are two seperate stories), but after playing that game for awhile, come back and play the game that started it all!

39880665.review:
Dead Rising is a time limited, high challenge sandbox zombie game set within a shopping mall where you control Frank West, a photojournalist (hes covered wars you know), as he dives in to the story knowing he only has 72 hours before he has to leave or be left behind to perish. So without a pause he charges forth, braves the dangers of the zombie infested mall and does his best to unravel the secrets of the outbreak!
...Or he just spends 72 hours playing bowling with zombies, sticking lego heads on them or jamming shower heads into the zombies heads just to see a blood fountain. Honestly, its up to you.

Im recommending this game because so much of what it does right, from the map design to the enemy design to the combat to the levelling to the (genuine part of the) difficulty. Especially when taken in the light of how early it was in a consoles cycle this sort of game was damn near unheard of at the time, and no game since (not even DR2) is quite the same. 


-THAT BEING SAID. There are serious downsides that come to light when going back and playing it more recently. For starters the combat tends to be a little derpy on the players end, from swings going straight through zombies to zombies skipping animations entirely and grabbing you in an instant while youre actively smacking them with something. This is typically offset by simply prioritising handguns, horizontal swing weapons and similar to avoid being in that situation entirely, but it would be foolish to imply that its not a flaw in the game.

-Another small but significant complaint would have to be that you use the same button to interact with literally every single thing in the game. Understandable, but when theres a pile of shite around, npcs following you and youre trying to pick something up or feed one of the npcs in a moment you dont have time to be slow with... you ARE going to do the wrong thing. Its literally unavoidable without having breathing room. Where it doesnt ruin you it adds to the experience of the game, but once again it would be foolish to imply its not a flaw.

-Possibly the most jarring and major flaw in the game (And you WILL experience this if you play) is that the AI are as dumb as a box of rocks. And thats putting it lightly. From getting stuck on bad pathing codes to LETTING themselves get eaten by zombies to just being derpy and useless in general, any situation where you have to guide the AI around becomes nothing but a tedious chore of banging your head against a brick wall. Couple this with the limited ability to save (which in itself isnt a problem) and suddenly youre standing there mashing the "Get the fuck over here you dumb fucks" button while watching an AI literally ignore you and get themselves killed. Again, and again, and again and again. The AI unfortunately make a good 75% of the difficulty in this game, and not by intentional design either. its entirely bad design and ruins what would be otherwise a stellar experience. Couple that with the control issues above and, well.... Pain and Suffering of the unfun kind.

Overall, the OG Dead Rising is by all means a game which you should delve into should you have played any of the others, even if simply to see where its roots come from. But if youre someone who cant stand really shoddy AI then id recommend skipping DR1 entirely and just hopping into DR2.

39872906.review:
One of the original games I played when I still had an xbox, I remember having fond memories after saving mall goers, foiling a bad guys plans, taking provocative photos and planting shower heads in zombies skulls.

I was overjoyed when I heard the original was coming to steam, a chance to relive one of the great zany, classic zombie games that spawned many sequels, after customising the controls to my liking I set about re-teaching myself the locales of the Willamette mall thankfully most of it came back easily including the hard-to-reach areas containing powerful weapons, sadly once I set about saving the malls occupants and escorting them back to the security room the unbelievably aggravating AI of the NPC's also came screaming back, it was prudent to save frequently as the survivors would often get themselves killed either from zombies or by my own hand as a result of my own hatred for their incompetence.

A game as dated as this one will obviously not have the best graphics but thats acceptable what bugged me slightly was the limited distance fade for objects (Enemies, Items, NPC's etc) which made planning a route difficult.

So in summary this game has plenty to offer for players who have the patience to put up with the survivors shoddy AI, upon completion new game modes become available, unlockable outfits and countless ways to thin the zombie hordes when you feel like blowing off steam, certainly worth the money.

WHAT YOU MIGHT LIKE:

+Interesting story and main characters
+The setting is very detailed with zero glitches, bugs, or crashes
+Music is awesome
+The game does not hold your hand, you can do whatever you want in the 3 in-game days. Finish missions, mess around, explore, rescue people, become stronger by leveling up, or just hide in a room for the entirety of the game. (Yes, you can still finish it that way) Your call.
+It stands the test of time. If you've never played it, but love horror games or the zombie genre, give it a try.
+Not too serious, it knows it's a game.

WHAT YOU MIGHT NOT LIKE:

-Not too serious, it knows it's a game.
-Survivor AI is more braindead than the zombies. Even though as a former security guard at a mall, I can garantee that there really are a lot of braindead people hanging out there, so the game is at least accurate, even if annoying.
-No improvements or difference to the Xbox 360 version.

39606082.review:
Ever imagined what it would be like to be stuck in a shopping mall full of zombies for goodness knows how long? This might be the answer.

There is so much creativity here, in fact, that you might as well be a completely new person every time you play this game. From throwing bottles of wine at zombies, to hitting crazed psychopaths with a TV, to taking photos of zombies with buckets on their heads, to eating baguettes at a fresh food market, to hacking zombies with a samurai sword... You can do all that and more while wearing whatever you desire - short pants and all. The story really isn't much to write home about, but the gameplay more than makes up for it. In addition, the numerous references to other Capcom properties are always satisfying to look out for.

Overall, if you are missing that old-school arcade game vibe, or you just want some good old fun with the undead, then you should definitely give this one a try.

39547517.review:
[h1]A game that stands the test of time.[/h1]

Thanks to this Remaster, the ever-classic Dead Rising has gotten a 1080p and 60fps full facelift. The game has never ran, or looked this good.
While some facial models and certain textures still look a little underwhelming, the attention to detail for Willamette's Mall, the zombie hordes that are an obstacle in your way, and Jessica's breasts make the game feel not as left-behind graphically as it's sequels (especially Dead Rising 2 and Dead Rising 4) will in the future. Playing at 60fps is like shackles have been removed from it, and it now feels all the more satisfying and smooth to play. I'd recommend installing this game on an SSD, as it makes loading times last less than 2 seconds, at most, making it an even bigger upgrade from the original Xbox version.

Ofcourse, those such things are expected from a remaster.
Gameplay-wise, I can tell you this game provided me with some of the most tense, exhilirating, and satisfying gaming moments of my life. The feeling of managing to escort around 3-4 survivors after beating a boss, and barely making it in time before the timer on the next Case starts, is just something unmatched by any other games so far.
The genius of Willamette Mall's setting is not something I can fully explain on a Steam review, but so many of its aspects resonate together to bring a very memorable experience. At the end of the day, zombies, and even some bosses aren't really that challenging, and you can ignore a lot of stuff while trying to do just the story if you want, but the fact that they are more like obstacles, that try to ruin your day as you help people in exchange for experience or accomplish story objectives as you run against the clock constantly, using anything and everything in the mall as a weapon, is the core of Dead Rising.
It's not meant to be a horror game, or even survival horror game. I'd describe it more as an "action-speedrunning" or "timed-sandbox" game, because that's what it's designed as. The fact that there's tons of hidden secrets and weapons, survivors, strategies, shortcuts, and even more discovered through exploration, serves to train you. So that you keep optimizing, improving, and learning. As most things carry over to your next playthough, even if you fail to do what you wanted or didn't get the best outcome last time, you can try again, with more knowledge, and stronger than before.
And, thanks to it's sandbox aspect, you can ignore all that if you want. Let the timer run and fail scoops as you dick around the mall trying children's clothes, play with toys, and mow down zombies like grass using CD jewel cases from the records store. All up to you.

Also has some of the most time-consuming, challenging achievements I've ever done, and I still haven't gotten all of them yet.
Frankly (no pun intended), I loved my time with this game. Though it was filled with frustration at times due to the horrible survivor AI, which hasn't been touched up or fixed at all, in the end, I came away with 34 hours of my life that just flew by thanks to having dumb fun in this zombie playground, or due to feeling ecstacy equal to finishing in a virgin hole by simply making it to the saferoom in the nick of time. I understand if the "timer" brings a red flag to many, but overall, I can't recommend Dead Rising enough. One of the all-time greats of Capcom's last-generation library, along with the first Lost Planet, Dragon's Dogma, and many more.

[i]Disclaimer: I have not tested the KB&M controls for this game, as I played through all of it with a controller. I'd recommend you do the same, but it shouldn't be that big of a deal.[/i]

39208942.review:
How do i review this game, this game is a very hard to put into a genre, its a mix of survival horror, action, drama and comedy all rolled into one giant sandbox location, this game was first released way back in 2006 for the Xbox 360 and became a beloved cult classic of sorts which left fans begging for a sequel which they obliged , now ten years later Capcom has ported the game over to the PC, Playstation 4 and Xbox One.

Now this port has had updates to the graphics, but not the most major of updates, if you've played the original on the 360 and have since purchased the PC port, you can tell there has been updates to the lighting, environment and characther models, but they are nothing to write home about.

Where this game truly shines is the port itself, time and time again, classic and beloved console titles have been ported to the PC and vice versa, and usually they come with a ton of graphical and gameplay glitches which leave the port feeling rushed and pushed to sale to make a quick profit, im glad to say that the game has been ported over brilliantly and feels very complete, all the side quests, rescue missions, psychopath bosses are here, and with the updated graphics it runs like a charm with no obvious frame rate drops.

Now the question is, if you have played this game on the 360 and have now changed over to PC gaming, is it worth a purchase, well at £15.99 this game is a lot cheaper then other AAA releases and still comes with tons of content to enjoy.

If your like me and enjoy replayability, this game has a lot of that, and comes with tons of achievements, most of those ported over from the 360, such as rescue a certain number of survivors, defeat certain bosses etc, and it is still a joy to play ten years after its original release.

I highly enjoy this game and would reccomend it to new players and fans of the orginal release as well, if you enjoy zombie games in general, and like a good story (be it a tad on the cliche side, AKA zombies in a shopping mall seen in both Dawn of the Dead movies) then you will highly enjoy this game.

39180665.review:
Sinscerely unrecommended. Avoid.
The game has a golden core surrounded by a hundred thousand terrible design decisions, most of which were rectified or at least mitigated quickly in far more enjoyable sequels.

Off of the top of my head.
- The base movement speed is quite slow, and there is no run. You get upgrades eventually, but those first few hours are quite painful.
- Until you unlock the endless mode, everything is timed. The timers are so strict that I'm fairly certain you can't do a 100% playthrough in a single run without some sort of exploit, and I'd be surprised to hear you could do a 80% playthrough on your first run. For a game with such time pressure, it certainly doesn't respect your time to expect three or four playthroughs to see what it has to offer.
- About 70% of the missions involve survivors, and survivors suck - flat out, and they ruin the game. Survivor AI is abysmal. The pathfinding is bottom tier, to the point where the simple task of moving across an empty courtyard not only takes ages, but is prone to error, a lot of dropped commands, and a lot of whining. It's one of those games where you are constantly mashing the command button to get the AI to follow you properly. Moving through a heavily infested zone is a chore at best, and just grueling otherwise. Survivors are also prone to getting caught by zombies, which prevents them from following you, and slowly chip away at their massive health bars (massive until you of course, accidentally hit a survivor with a sudden insta-kill move). This is not to mention about a third of survivors do not accept weapons (not that they can use them competently anyways), and half of those need to be carried, preventing you from attacking or helping any survivors inevitably falling behind.
- Boss fights are weird. They start at a high difficulty level, and then just kinda plateau from there. Dead Rising 2 has this issue too, in boss enemies take crazy amounts of damage, do crazy amounts of damage, have a lot of I-frames, and feel completely separate from the rest of the game, but will die really fast to one or two cheap weapons against them.
- Whoever designed Cultists needs to be shot. Whoever okayed the idea that cultists can kill a survivor in one or two explosions needs to be shot. Whoever thought of the pocket-sand ability for cultists, also needs to be shot. Twice.
- The ancient hatred for Otis was 100% justified. He also ruins the game with the radio. The player has to stop everything, attacking, jumping, falling, dodging, triggering cutscenes, going into new load zones, even taking damage, just have to wait out 3 or 4 extremely slow paced text boxes to get a mission - every single time. And if that radio message is interupted? You're punished with an additional text box, and the whole thing has to start over again. Someone else needed to be shot.

It is a real tragedy to see the original game was like this, because I highly recommend the sequels. Somewhere deep down here, was the core of very fun game waiting to come out. Lots of items to find and use, an interesting plot and setting, campy writing, and intriguing camera mechanic. Shot so close to brilliance, and hit a hundred miles away. PC port also isn't bad at all. Some studdering when you hit a bunch of enemies at once with a sledgehammer, but that's hardly anything to complain about.
3/10

There is alot to do, like killing hordes of zombies, dressing in drag, killing psychos, and saving other survivors. The psychos act as boss battles. The only downside is the survivor AI. Their path finding is the worst you will ever see. Later games in the series fixed it fortunately. I love my games challenging, but this is unfair challenge. I managed to beat it 100%, but that survivor AI is random. They get stuck, they take longer routes to areas, even when there is a clear path, and they will run into zombies. They are retarded. 38926510.review:
Dead Rising is such a difficult game to review, in the sense that this will almost be a defense to its flaws.  However, should the player accept the game for what it is, and specifically why Dead Rising is what it is, they'll appreciate this as a genuinely fun and unique game.

Effectively, this is Dawn of the Dead: The Game.  You play as Frank West, a photojournalist literally dropped into a shopping mall full of zombies, whose goal is to survive until it's all over.  Along the way, there are a myriad of zombies to deal with, as well as survivors of varying behaviors.  Along with saving certain people, you'll encounter other individuals with their own agendas.  Without giving too much of the story away, it does a great job of balancing the aspects of not taking itself seriously (via the various characters) and the over the top serious plot.  This combines for a campy theme that really works for this game.

The unique game mechanics specific to Dead Rising is where it becomes a bit polarizing, but there's a method to the madness.  For starters, the player most likely WILL LOSE during their first playthrough.  If they want to keep their level progression, they MUST start over to the beginning of the game.   However, this is a survival game, and it's tough to stay alive against tens of thousands of zombies.  However, what most reviews here seem to not mention, is that subsequent plays get exponentially easier by design.  As Frank gains experience points (called PP), the player gains levels that unlock various abilities.  These include a ton of new moves, health, inventory slots, speed increases, and so on.  This game has tons of side missions that help the player gain levels at a reasonable pace, and this game is very much beatable in no time.  Spend some time with the game, and Dead Rising will reward you.

The survival aspect shows up in other ways, too.  Some people complain about the lack of save points, but where's the challenge in surviving if the player can save anywhere and anytime they want?  There are several save points throughout the mall, including the safe room that the game directs you to go to numerous times, so the lack of save opportunities are completely overstated.  The in-game time is always going, too, which may prevent players from getting to all the missions they want to.  However, again, this is a survival game, and time is of the essence -- especially in a game that requires survival for a specific period of time.  With each session of play, the player should find more efficient ways of navigating through the mall and progressing through the story.  It's definitely possible to complete all side quests and main missions during the time limit, with ample time to spare.

The probable highlight of Dead Rising is the important part -- the gameplay.  This game is just so much fun, in that there are so many ways to play.  If the player wants to play the story, go for it.  If they want to do the side quests and forget about the main missions, the game allows them to do that.  If people just want to mindlessly kill as many zombies as they can, Dead Rising allows for that too.  Regardless of the goal, the player has MANY different ways to deal with the various enemies, as Frank can use nearly anything he sees as a weapon or a buff.  Some items are lethal, some items are complementary, some items can help assist with healing or abilities, and other items are just outright silly.  Dead Rising is very free-form in what weapons to use for fights, albeit some weapons are better than others.  Overall, this game just absolutely nails it in this department.

The controls are a mixed bag.  Keeping in mind that this was a 2006 console game, Dead Rising is admittedly better suited for a controller.  Using a mouse and keyboard is certainly doable, but the control layout is clunky.  However, the controller support is very good.  Movement is good, and attacking enemies is solid.  While the melee tracks and hits pretty well, aiming guns and projectiles can be a chore.  However, the worst thing about this game has to be leading survivors to safety.  It's easier to guide Hellen Keller through a bomb defusal than it is to guide the AI to the safe room.  The AI pathing is just abysmal.  You can equip them with weapons, but it usually doesn't matter; once they meet zombies, it's a chore to free them.  It was the major complaint back in 2006, and it's even worse in retrospect now.  Beyond that, the game plays fine.

The game shows its age a bit, but unlike Jenny McCarthy's face post-botox, Dead Rising still looks good.  It's well-optimized, and it feels good to play this in 1080p and get 300fps with max settings.  The sheer amount of zombies on the screen at once doesn't really induce any frame drops at all, so the game feels ultra-smooth.  Game looks good for being from 2006, and the sound is serviceable enough, too.  Zombies groan everywhere, sound effects sound like they should, dialogue is intentionally bad and hilarious, and to top off -- Gone Guru (oh, you'll know about it soon enough).  The presentation fits the zombie survival campy vibe it strives to represent.

Dead Rising is really fun, but the player needs to start with an understanding mindset to truly appreciate it.  This is not a typical one-playthrough game -- rather, it's a sandbox game.  It is recommended to just play and have fun, but also accept that dying and losing is likely inevitable.  It'll make surviving and completing the game that much sweeter.  Once this is understood, this game a ton more enjoyable.  In my opinion, Dead Rising is a damn good game.

38900587.review:
Fan of zombie games? Then keep on reading to see if this one is your alley aswell.

Dead Rising is an older game from 2006 and you play as a reporter. You've heard of possible big news scoop and thus booked an helitour over the location of the scoop, to take some pictures for the planned article. You end up being so facinated from the situation (outbreak), that you actually want to go on foot-level to investigate into this Willamette Mall. But as while you're preparing to drop into the mall from the heli, military who've quarantined the area, attempts to seize your attempts by trying to bring the helicopter down.
The helicopter pilot cannot actually stay for you but has to abandon the place inorder to save their own ass. Before abandoning you, they did make a deal with you that they'd come back for you in 3 days (72hrs) at 12pm and so you've got 72hrs to build your case while at the Willamette Mall. This is Dead Rising.

What the game does well, is without doubt [h1]atmosphere[/h1] it delivers. Those zombies do look and sound like they're serious business and that you don't wanna mess with them unless you've got something that's bigger than your fists. When you open up a maintenance hallway door and you'll find yourself from an hallway that is full of zombies and in your inventory you've got 30 bullets on your handgun + couple melee weapons.. you're not really sure regardless of having the handgun, if you really should be there or not. That's kinda greatly done disturbing atmoshpere imo.

It is safe to say back then when game originally released, it was something quite new and novel. This atleast as far as openworld-ish+zombie combination is concerned. However but as time has passed.. it doesn't really hold up too well anymore. And following is my assestment about it.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1] seems to be just flat out dumb in my opinion. Basically just kill zombies in bunch of different ways with really clunky controls, combat mechanics and limited gameworld possibilities. The mall is big and that is nice but really all you can do there is to kill zombies, try on different clothes, wander around different stores looking to find some health items, photograph different things (yes afterall you are an reporter) or go for these side objectives that are always on the entire opposite side of the mall. 
Since you move really slow.. traveling accross the mall takes quite a while until you reach your destination. So you start thinking [i]why should I really do those side missions since it's just going back and forth the mall for nothing basically?[/i] Really makes you feel like a "hamster in a wheel".
 
There isn't really that much else to do in here but to mindlessly mow down zombies. So would you like to be killing zombies in location A: water foundation area of mall, or would you like to be killing zombies in location B: outdoors small section with a pack of armed prisoners running over people with a truck, or perhaps location C: dark lit movietheater area where corridors are tiny and cramped? Regardless of the location, possiblities are same. Either run from the zombies or kill them. Pretty boring after you've done that for a while already. 

When actually playing the campaign, it really feels like you're just a "hamster in a wheel" in here. [i]Do this do that go there go here.[/i] And for what? Just to rescue a couple into the safehouse and lose majority of your equipment while doing so? Yeah no thanks. Zombies if you kill from an area and then backtravel even only 5-10meters, those zombies will respawn all and your weapons actually break. 

There is a really dumb and non-practical item system in the game. You have 4-5slots and those you place [u]both weapons and health items[/u] into. It's really nice when you're in a hectic handfight and then all the sudden your weapon breaks and replaces it with an health item. So you pressed the attack key because you were in a fight situation and while the hp item was equipped, now you've just decided to eat an item while youre being attacked. So you not only wasted your valuable item but you also lost health because the zombies managed to tackle you down while you stopped down to eat. 
So you might say "well bind hotkeys dude". Hehe, there isn't any hotkeys. To scroll the items you have, you need to use mousewheel (next/prev weapon) to select an item/weapon. There are no bindable actual weapons.

Movement is really clunky. You press once a directional key and the guy is instantly sprinting fullspeed into that direction. Way too sensitive and hard to reliably and accurately control.

Closecombat is quite horrendous here. There is no lock-on systems or any sorts of [b]fightmode[/b] or whatever. So often times you find yourself missing hits or accidentally punching an ally, since you can't really control where you're hitting once you've pressed the punch key.

Aiming anything in this game is actually quite a nightmare to do with traditional PC mouse+kb [h1]controls[/h1]. This game is anything but ideal for that. There is heavy amount of mouse acceleration applied and so you can never really comfortably and reliably aim. On top of there being mouse accel.. there also is this thing how the aiming works in this game. Lets say you're looking up and then press the aim button. You'd think you'd now be aiming into the spot you were looking before pressing the aim key right? Well nope. Here you instead everytime gotta accept that the game auto-centers your aim and then you gotta manually move the camera up again. Imagine this in a hectic situation. Yeah it's not a fun or smooth experience at all. Constantly needing to re-align your aiming because of the auto centering thing resetting it. Tedious.

[h1]Audio[/h1] in this game is quite bad. You can be in a room and eventhough there is absolutely nobody else in this room, you can actually [b]clearly[/b] hear the zombie growls and noises behind the wall. So often times youre walking forexample in an upper level balcony and you keep hearing noises from whatever direction and then you have to look and you see nothing. Then you realize "oh, it's just them on the ground level floor making noises". Thats how well the directional audio works in this game. You can't at all tell wether sound is coming from above or below you and due to the lack of any kinda Occlusion sound effects.. you'll never know if someone is right by next to you, or there is an entire wall between you and them. So talk about system being confusing.

Dead Rising does a very poor job of introducing how the game works and infact.. it kinda throws everything at you all at once. Making the player WTF as the game starts throwing different things at them. When I started, I didn't really at all know how the objective system worked because the [h1]tutorial/guides/introduction[/h1] were so badly executed in-game. So when the game finally actually began and I started seeing these random names pop-up "JOE IS DEAD" "ANNA IS DEAD" etc.. I was wondering wether I should care and do I [b]NEED[/b] to prevent this or will Game Over screen come otherwise? It didn't tell me any of this and instead I decided to go where a guy was yelling people from the upper balcony to come over there. Turns out that was the way to go.

Then there's the actual map [h1]UI[/h1] for objectives and game UI in general. It is completely unclear are objectives on which floor and what exactly it is that you have to do there. Missions don't have any kinda mission descriptions but just the mission name and that's it. There was forexample an objective which name was something like "Investigate the monitor room". Here I was in the room where the objective was and nothing happened. Even talking to the woman sitting there did nothing. Then I revisited this room sometime later and now the game decided to play the cutscene all the sudden. Seriously! What the hell? Could have had an actual mission description that says "the mission will trigger only at specific time or so.

38337551.review:
[h1]No es el mejor juego de zombies ni el mejor port, pero está muy bien[/h1]

Sobre el port: Según recuerdo jugarlo en consola, ha ganado fluidez(Y diría que calidad) gráfica aunque sigue teniendo un ligero framedrop al matar a los zombies que sobretodo al principio se hace molesto. Siendo un fallo que acompañó al original tampoco es algo de lo que quejarse. Además está todo bastante configurable, es compatible con todas las resoluciones y personalmente no he tenido ningún problema técnico.

El juego en sí nos sitúa en un tono a medio camino entre el holocausto dramático y el cómico, para mi gusto mejor posicionado que su segunda parte aunque también me gustó la crítica social más honda que hace en éste.  
La jugabilidad es lo mejor y lo peor de la saga, por un lado recuerda a ese estilo Arcade tan propio de Capcom que mantiene de la vieja escuela pero por otro puede llegar a presentarse como todo un desafío del grindeo hasta alcanzar las cotas más altas de nivel donde pasarse el juego ya mucho mejor preparado, matando a Frank cada par de días para rascar niveles sin pasarlo mal.
A decir verdad aunque no me parezca un juego de 10 sí es novedoso para su momento, con bastante personalidad y una buena elección para los gamers más casual o los más avezados. 

Aunque me considero una persona muy crítica, no veo ninguna razón por la que darle thumbs down, así que personalmente lo recomendaría.

38145332.review: I always found this game lackluster when it was on the 360. If I could narrow it down to a single reason, it would be the controls never felt great - particularly the aiming set up. On PC, I pretty much have no reason to complain. This port is definitely one of the better ones in existence and it couldn't have happened to a better game. There is one downside of this port is that the inputs seem to be read raw, which is a bit inconvenient for my left-hand mouse (e.g. despite swapping my mouse buttons in Windows, they revert to the mouse's default 'right button = left click' native setting). The scenario is pretty much Dawn of the Dead, with Frank and bunch of other survivors trapped in a shopping mall, trying to figure out how everything happened and escape 3 days later. The assortment of weapons is compelling and the fact that Frank levels up as he rescues surivivors, fights psychopaths, and uncovers more of the story is the icing on the cake. Really fun, replayable game with a lot of memorable characters. It's absolutely worth picking up during a sale, but even at $20 it's a steal. You WILL get hours of play time out of your investment - don't worry!

38050861.review:
Como porte, cumpre seu trabalho: Suporte para Full HD (não sei quão bem funciona em 4K, não posso testar), 60 FPS, e não presenciei bugs, crashes ou glitches no tempo que eu joguei. Porém, não posso recomendar Dead Rising, por conta de alguns motivos que estragaram a experiência para mim. Um dos pontos que tornaram o jogo frustrante para mim foi a inteligência artificial, pois um dos objetivos do jogo é resgatar os sobreviventes espalhados pelo shopping, e nas minhas tentativas de levá-los à segurança, observei que eles tinham uma tendência a ficarem presos em objetos espalhados pelo mapa, andando no mesmo lugar, a andarem bem no meio de uma horda de zumbis, mesmo quando rotas mais seguras estão disponíveis, a se esquecerem de usar a arma que estão carregando, ou a de simplçesmente não seguir Frank. Dada a importância dessa mecãnica no jogo, não acho aceitável que ela tenha sido aprovada neste estado, não é desafiador, é apenas frustrante. Outro fator que me incomodou muito foi o fato de que na grande maioria das vezes que Frank sofre dano por um zumbi, ele entra em uma animação longa, onde o jogador precisa usar o analogico ou algum botão para se livra do zumbi, e devido ao número de zumbis,  á falta de clareza em muitos momentos da animação de ataque dos zumbis, ao frquente posicionamento incoveniente da câmera, e á lentidão do protagonista, essas animações acontecerão com frequência, e não demorará para que a repetitividdade as torne tediosas e frustrantes.

Muitas escolhas de design parecem não combinam bem: dada a quantidade de zumbis e o número de objetos que podem ser usados como armas, assume-se que o jogo estimula a experimentação, mas alguns objetos são literalmente inúteis, outros são tão desajeitados que seu uso apenas serve para deixar Frank mais vulnerável, e Frank já é quase tão vulnerável quanto o típico protagonista de "survival horror", exceto que ele precisa lidar com um número significantemente amior de inimigos, o que não abre muito espaço para experimentação, infelizmente. Outra contradição é o fato de que é possível andar por todo o shopping, explorando as lojas e procurando objetos, mas praticamente todas as missões precisam ser realizadas em um limite de tempo, portanto o jogador não pode se dar ao luxo de passar muito tempo explorando um mapa que está pedindo para ser explorado. O sistema de "save" manual, onde é possível salvar apenas em p-ontos específicos, em banheiros, é uma mecânica que eu geralmente gosto em jogos estilo "survival-horror", mas os outros problemas a transformam em mais uma fonte de frustração.

Esteticamente, Dead Rising envelheceu mal. Eu sei que é um jogo lançado há 11 anos atrás, um título de lançamento do 360, mas jogos lançados para consoles da geração anterior (PS2, Xbox, Gamecube) envelheceram bem melhor nesse aspecto (No momento, consigo pensar em Resident Evil 4 e Metal Gear Solid 3, mas existem outros exemplos), então ter sido lançado há tanto tempo atrás não é uma justificativa sólida. 

Dead Rising tem boas ideias, mas a execução, infelizmente, é fraca. O sistema de criação de armas da continuação serviria para aliviar vários dos problemas que eu citei, além de ser muito divertida e combinar mais com o que eu acho que era a proposta do primeiro jogo, portanto recomendo que os interessados pela série comecem pelo segundo jogo, e pulem essa primeira tentativa que teve boas intenções, mas foi falha.

37987562.review:
Dead Rising es un juego dificil de jugar, y no es porque sea dificil(aunque sus mecanicas lo hacen un poco estricto), sino porque por lo que he leido por ahi es que para jugarlo "bien" y "disfrutarlo" debes jugarlo muchas veces. Y no se si eso esta en lo correcto pero la verdad que eso es lo que he hecho y no me arrepiento ya que lo disfrute mucho mas en mi tercera partida. Es en mi opinion uno de los juegos de matar zombies con las maneras mas originales y divertidas. Estas en un centro comercial y tienes todo, que quede claro, TODO, a tu disposicion para matar y joder a los zombies de todas las maneras que quieras. No estoy mintiendo cuando digo que lo ultimo que vas a usar para matarlos son armas de fuego, ya que estas no son nada efectivas y escasean mucho. Ademas de los zombies hay personas que han perdido la cabeza por culpa de la invasion, por lo que se dan situaciones muy divertidas y graciosas con estos. 
La mecanica principal del juego es sin lugar a dudas el manejo del tiempo, tienes un tiempo determinado para ayudar a los supervivientes, matar a esos psicopatas y hacer misiones principales todo en el mismo tiempo. Esto puede entorpecer la aventura un poco ya que el juego es muy estricto en este apartado y tiende a darte misiones encima de misiones con un limite de tiempo muy apreciable, pero una vez sabes que hacer y donde, esto ya no es un problema. 

Dead Rising es la prueba de que Capcom si que sabia cuidar sus juegos, ya que lo que veo es que le han cuidado hasta el mas minimo detalle, tiene un gran mimo y cariño puesto en el y basicamente tiene muchoamor por los videojuegos.
A pesar de su poco amigable manejo del tiempo y la escasa inteligencia artificial de los NPCs  esto esta mas que recomendado, es dificil encontrar un juego asi.

PD: Muere Otis, muere!!!!

37740116.review:
This is a good port. If you have a good enough PC to play on high it looks real sharp. Fixes the 'text issue' 360 had. This is a real zombie game too, you don't have some 'cool military background' that makes you a special zombie killer with your own special weapon. You're in a mall, use what you can and smash some zombies with a tv/golf club/bowling ball.

Controls are nice, but you can't customize. Using a gun in the game is so clunky. There's no smoothness at all, nobody in the developing team was like "man we should fix that a little, ya think?" nope, all good boys. It's a zombie game, why shoot 'em?

AI still sucks, you're able to run through a spotty mob easily, but no matter what you do -- your tag alongs will always attract them. But hey, you can get away with smacking them with a baseball bat to 'clear the zombies', like smacking someone on the face for a 'mosquito.'

Timing is very difficult, I played the original 360 and didn't get all the people saved, so this time I used a little guide to help determine when and where to move. It is possible to 'collect them all' the first go-around, but it's very hard.

Frank still can't fight. He couldn't in the original, he still sucks in this one. So the last fight in the game is literally won using only 1 real move and hoping to god you don't screw up.

No matter what, you will find tons of time killed by just running around killing zombies in the most creative and dumbest ways possible, wearing the most creative and dumbest things possible.

37278151.review:
I had never truly played this game when I owned it on my 360 and seemingly never played it, I forgot about it. However, recently I had gotten a huge urge to actually play the game only to find out that the copy I had was lost. But enough of that, this is a review after all. Essentially I'll be talking about how my experiences were and what the mechanics are like and the story and such. Also a bit of a warning, there will be some spoilers in here so please be mindful of that, all names 
 and eventsthat are used in the game will be spoilered to help this. 

Story:
In Dead Rising you play as photo journalist Frank West, looking for the next big scoop to give hime a breakthrough only to find out that the town is overrun by zombies. The story gave off a good B movie sort of horror feeling to it which gave it some charm with how cheesy some scenes are and what not. But overrall, it was pretty nice and had its moments. 

Gameplay:
Oh boy this is gonna be a fun topic to cover. The gameplay of Dead Rising can be summed up as: You're in this giant mall with zombies, food, weapons, and other cool shit, now go do things with them. In all seriousness though, the gameplay is surprisingly fun to play with. The timer gimmick is one that I like personally since it makes you use good use of your time and pretty much force you to use time management. There were a number of times during my many playthroughs that I had trouble choosing one thing over the other. THings like "Should I go off and fight this guy or should I save some suriviors first?" are what make the time gimmick fun and interesting. Other than that, Dead Rising portrays its bosses in the form of Psychopaths or survivors that went crazy during the outbreak. All the fights are fun and well thought out and have nice strategies to with them. Things like [spoiler]Cliff's gimmick of teleporting around the arena is interesting, Adam's fight being challenging early on if you're low leveled, etc.[/spoiler] Other than these, the game features books which are sort of like stat boosters on certain things. The books can do various effects on things like weapon durablitites, health gain from certain foods, being able to deal more damage on certain things, etc. My personal favorite sets of books to use are the infamous three books that go with the [spoiler]Mini Chainsaw[/spoiler] that everyone else knows and loves. With books, psychos, and time, there are many other things in the game that need to be talked about. One of the main things is its level system where you can gain PP, Player Points, from doing various things in the game. One of the main ways to gain PP is either through completing scoops (Survivors and pyschos) or through taking photos of things, to which I will touch on as well. As you level up, you gain things like new abilities, more health blocks, more inventory slots, and more throwing distance. Now I mentioned earlier that you can take photos to gain PP. Essentially, there's a photography gimmick as well since well, Frank's a photojournalist. Photography has a grading scale with certain genres of things and what not. These genres are things like Horror, Drama, Outtake, Erotic, Special, No Genre. Along with the genres come a thing called Photo Ops, which are special poses some characters will do throughout the game. Certain psychos do these and survivors do them as well. Aside from that, the game grades you based on well you take a picture and rewards PP for your troubles. Depending on how well the picture, it can easily score you either really low amounts of PP or a large about of PP. Moving on, we have weapons and what they basically do. Weapons are literally everywhere in the Willamette Mall, they can be hidden in stores or just lying around somewhere. Now, weapons have a gimmick where if you use them too much they break and are well, unusuable. To combat this, as stated earlier, you can get books with certain effects on certain types of weapons. For instance, a sports related book will provided bonuses on sports related weapons (soccer balls, frisbies, hockey sticks, etc.). And not only that, but you can also stack these effects to make them even more durable so you won't have to worry about getting a new one. Other than that, the combat in the game is fun, simple, and to the point. However there are things like QTEs at certain instances, namely after getting grabbed/attacked too much which can tire Frank out. Essentially what can happen is you either don't take damage at all for suriving the QTE or, you fail the QTE and you take DOUBLE the damage. Now that's enough about the gameplay, I liked it for what it offered and you probably will too!

Final Thoughts/Conclusion:
As a whole, Dead Rising was a fun experience and gave me a lot of memories that will probably stick with me forever. [spoiler]Things like the Convicts making me nearly shit my pants while escorting survivors are one of the many things.[/spoiler] I didn't find myself not hating or disliking any part of the game aside from maybe a few nitpicky things but overall I like the game a ton and give it my 10/10 seal of approval.

I hope you found this review helpful as I had fun writing this and I hope you enjoy the game!

37010341.review:
[b]Mean Mr. Mustard's short Dead Rising review[/b]

 [h1]1) Essential - buy it NOW[/h1]
 2) Recommended - buy it on sale
 3) Avoid

Time to complete – 15 hours to complete campaign
Played multiplayer? N/A
Worth revisiting? Yes, The Mall is huge with lots of secrets to discover. Also, extra modes unlock upon completion.

Best part – The setting and characters are fantastic and a lot of fun to interact with. Willamette Mall is one of the best environments in a video game, not too big and not too small, with bucket loads of character and hidden secrets. The NPCs all have their own stories to tell and the Psychopaths are all unique and a concept pretty much invented by this game. The real star of the show though is Frank West, just a regular guy in an irregular situation, who doesn't take no bullshit and always manages to bring some humour to the show. Oh and he's "covered wars ya'know"

Worst part – The survivors A.I., while the survivors themselves are a brilliant concept, be prepared to do a lot of hand-holding (literally!) while escorting them to safety.

36873037.review:
Este juego hace unas 10 cosas bien pero 1000 mal y es frustrante como el solo.
Las mecánicas, contra los bosses son horrible, la mayoría de las batallas consisten en correr en dirección al boss y cuando estés cerca golpearlo, que te golpee tirandote al suelo, y estar unos 5 minutos de reloj repitiendo lo mismo una y otra y otra vez. 
La IA de los npcs es probablemente la peor que vi en mi vida, no puedo entender como pudo salir un juego a la venta con una inteligencia artificial tan pobre, y además teniendo en cuenta que es tan sumamente importante en este juego. De 50 supervivientes que me abre encontrado pude salvar solo 10, todo por la IA tan mala que tienen, que se quedan trabados con cada uno de los miles de zombis que te encuentras hasta el refugio. Mi decisión para no frustrarme y terminar abandonando el juego fue pasar de largo de los supervivientes y se lo recomiendo a todos que prueben este juego.
Casi todo en el juego esta muy mal pensado, si me pusiera a nombrar todos los errores no terminaría nunca, pero una de las cosas que mas me molesto es que cada vez que se te informa de una mision te quedás sin poder realizar ningún movimiento que no sea caminar, y si algún zombi o cualquier cosa te corta la animación de la llamada, hay que volver a escucharla desde el principio todas las veces que sean necesarias hasta que la termines.
La limitación de tiempo fue algo que nunca me gusto en la saga, me parece una estupidez poner un mapa gigantesco con zombis infinitos, y con cientos y cientos de maneras de matarlos, y poner limitación de tiempo para que se termine el juego, pero en los otros juegos de la saga te daban el tiempo suficiente para completar todas las misiones y relajarse matando zombis por ahí de vez en cuando, no es el caso de este juego, aunque vayas directo
a las misiones sin distraerte en nada es imposible completarlas todas, tanto por el poco tiempo que dan como la inteligencia artificial de los npcs que te tendrían que seguir pero no lo hacen.
En cuanto al port a pc no tengo ninguna queja, funciona perfecto y tiene bastantes opciones gráficas.
En su lanzamiento este juego fue muy querido por ser tan innovador pero hoy en día es infumable por las mecánicas que tiene, en cambio recomiendo comprar el 2 que vale lo mismo y es practicamente lo mismo que este pero con la mayoría de problemas anteriormente nombrados solucionarlos.

36313261.review:
One of the few great games of the 7th generation. Took 10 years but finally came to PC in 4K and 60 FPS, ironically most people didn't have HDTVs when this game first came out. In hindsight, the game is still solid if not a bit clunky from odd design choices.

Play as Frank West, Photographer and Crossdressing extraordinaire. You have 72 in-game hours to uncover the conspiracy behind Capcom using the basic premise of George Romero's Dawn of the Dead. Drink copious amounts of Orange Juice, slam dumbbells into Zombies' faces, mash the Y-Button while babysitting mentally handicapped AI Survivors for that precious PP, struggle with every damage sponge boss fight until you learn about the Mini Chainsaw and Books.  Bask in the early-game joys of running around at a snails pace trying to make it to each mission in time. 

The game 'ends' if you miss a main story mission but there are multiple endings depending on certain factors, and you can still free-roam, complete survivor/boss missions, and earn most of the achievements until the Helicopter arrives. However, you won't get the true ending but you'll still get the reward items for your next playthrough if you complete certain achievements regardless.

If you're not a bad enough dude to handle this: grind the Helicopter section until you hit Lvl. 50, ignore the story, and run around bodyslamming zombies for 8 hours instead. If you're feeling really testy, overhead throw the fat couple you save in the beginning of the game into a pit of the undead mercillessly.

This is still the best game in the series. Dead Rising 2 is a worthy, but in some ways lesser follow-up that improved the formula. Don't bother with the other games.

36292434.review:
일단 재밌다. 생존자만 쥐뿔도 신경 안 쓴다면 혼자서 좀비고 싸이코패스고 다 쓸어담을 수 있다. 
다만 처음 몇 번은 진행이 막힐 수도 있는데, 정해진 시각에 맞춰 특정 위치로 가야 하는 메인 퀘스트는 다른 거 하다가 시간 놓쳐버리면 게임 오버가 된다. 이걸 깨닫기 전에는 도대체 왜 오라는 곳에 왔는데 이벤트가 발생하지 않고 게임오버되는지 이해를 할 수 없었다. 예를 들면 오전 6시까지 보안실로 가야 하는 메인퀘스트는 시간이 지나버리면 실패하는 식. 물론 그 시각을 칼같이 정확히 지킬 것까지는 없는 모양이다만 대충 5분 이상의 오차는 허용하지 않는 것 같다. 이런 거 신경쓰다보면 내가 지금 메인퀘에 집중해야 하는데 생존자 구출을 할 여유가 있는지 시간계산을 많이 하게 되므로 고민하는 것도 제법 쏠쏠한 재미.

이 게임의 가장 큰 암덩어리(아마 사실 유일한 암덩어리)라면 바로 생존자. 개발진의 의도라고는 하지만 기본적으로 생존자가 멍청하다. 하는 꼬라지 보면 답답해서 미칠 지경. 오라는데 안 오고 찔찔 짜던지 도움! 도움! 이짓거리만 반복하고 결국 좀비에게 물려서 죽는다. 혹은 남들 다 따라오는데 지만 쥐털만한 문턱이나 벽같은 거에 걸려 못 따라와서 구해주러 간 사이 잘 따라오던 다른 생존자들이 미처 챙겨주지 못한 고 사이에 죽어버리는 일도 다반사(일본인 두 명 구하는데 한 놈이 장애물에 걸려 못 따라와서 구해주러 간 사이 잘 따라오던 다른 사람이 여좀비한테 ㅈ을 물려 죽는 것도 봤다). 남 죽이는 민폐캐짓을 개나소나 다 한다. 게다가 이거 무슨 여혐조장 게임인지 생존자들 중에 여자는 미치도록 쓸모가 없다. 기본적으로 따라오라면 잘 따라오는 생존자들 중에서, 남성의 경우는 부상자만 아니면 직접 이고 지고 다닐 필요도 없고 무기같은 것도 쥐어줘서 어느 정도는 스스로 자기방어를 할 수도 있다. 근데 여성의 경우는 부상자는 물론이고 사지 멀쩡한 년들도 위에서 말한 도움! 도움! 엉엉엉 이짓거리만 하고, 따라오라면 죽자사자 뛰어오는 게 아니라 곱상하게 사뿐사뿐 오는데 보고 있으면 답답해 미친다. 가장 큰 문제는 얘들의 대부분이 무기를 쥐어주지 못 하기 때문에 전투는 당연히 못 하고 해줄 수 있는 건 업어주거나 손잡고 끌고가는 거밖에 없다는 점이다. 선봉에 서서 좀비를 도륙내며 길을 터야 할 주인공이 사지 멀쩡하니 뭐라도 쥐면 싸울 수 있을 것 같은 애들을 손잡고 이끌어야 한다는 거다. 이런 애들이 두세명 이상 되면? 환장한다. 진짜 환장한다. 빨리 오라고 하면 이놈은 문턱을 못 넘어 걸리고 저년은 도움도움 앵무새에 요놈은 부축해줘야 하고 조년은 가자는데 안 따라오고. 생존자들 하는 거 보면 "살려주겠다는데도 멍청하면 뒈져야지 넌 뒈져라 그냥" 이런 말은 심심찮게 나오고 없던 여혐도 생길 지경...진짜 괜히 여혐조장하는 게임이라고 생각하는 게 아니다.

뭐 이런 거 빼면 정말 재밌다. 다만 이미 말했듯 메인퀘스트는 생존자를 구하거나 좀비를 잡는데만 집중하다가 시간 놓쳐 실패하고 처음부터 다시 하게  되는 일이 많으니 유의할 것. 저장 수시로 하자. 마캡3 하다가 얘 나오길래 궁금해서 충동적으로 산 거긴 하지만 지금도 암걸려가며 재밌게 하는 게임.

This game may be nostalgic for some, but it obviously hasn't aged well. Nevermind the lack of autosave, the heavy need for backtracking, or the frustrating bosses, the AI for the people that need rescuing is terrible.

I begrudgingly make my way back to a safe room, hindered the whole way by the survivor. I'm almost there, but another group of zombies is in the way. As I raise the sledgehammer (which seems to only have a vertical striking motion), the survivor walks in front of me, and is immediately one-shotted by me. A few reiterations of this process (reload previous save point, walk to survivor, walk back to safe room, fail) is just bad design in my eyes.

35868386.review:
An absolutely incredible game and a great port, there's lot of graphical options, you can completely remap both the keyboard keys and gamepad buttons.
The game's storyline isn't full of sudden, inpredictable twists, but it does a good job of keeping you interested. The characters are really good and dialogue is well written. Frank West, the protagonist, is really likeable and relatable while not being another super good looking, always joking, all knowing protagonist.
One of the game's biggest features are the psychopahts, who serve as the bosses in the game. They are unique enemies with their own personalities, design and themes, which are all absolutely amazing.
Anothe really big feature and the main selling point of the game is that you can use pretty much anything as a weapon. Chairs, benches, hammers, katanas, chainsaws, guns, shotguns, sniper rifles, machine rifles, toy guns, golf clubs, baseball bats, etc. You also have a very impressive arseanl of amazing melee moves that are unlocked as you gain levels.
The graphics are nice and have clearly aged well. The music is well done and is used in just the right way.
However, perhaps the most important thing about the game is the challenge that it presents.
The game doesn't tell you how to do everything perfectly and there's a pretty big chance that you won't do everything perfectly on your first run. However, there's nothing more satisfying than escorting a bunch of brain dead survivors back to the safehouse. Even though they're pretty much a liability, you still feel great after saving them and it really gives you the feeling that you've made a difference.
Another big part of the game is photography. You're able to photograph all sorts of things for extra experience and to perform certain missions.
The game world is done just right, not too big and not too small. It's good to try and get a hang of the area's layout to maximise your effectiveness. All the areas in the game are easily distinguishable from one another and there's always something to do and some new items to find.
Dead Rising gives you some choices to make. Many of your actions have consequences and some missions have multiple possible outcomes. Furthermore, the game features over 6 endings, depending on your actions.
I really recommend that you pick it up, it's an amazing game and an incredibly well made port.
9.5/10, with half a point being taken away due to survivors' dumb AI.

35694712.review:
该作是2006年XBOX 360独占游戏《丧尸围城》的十周年重制版。

[h1]+自由欢乐的丧尸沙盒[/h1]

[h1]+丰富有趣的武器[/h1]
地图中分布着各种各样有趣的武器道具，各有优缺点，部分道具设计十分幽默。

[h1]+扎实的动作手感[/h1]
除却各式武器，主角还能够学习不少相当实用的徒手攻击动作，动作设计和手感都相当好。如果你说CAPCOM做不好游戏的动作性，那么谁做得好呢？

[h1]+中上的剧本水准[/h1]

[h1]+设计优秀的支线和BOSS[/h1]
不少幸存者的剧情都有不错的质量。[b]精神病BOSS的设计非常出色，是该系列的一大亮点[/b]（对于4代取消精神病BOSS的行为表示不能理解并强烈谴责）。

[h1]-在如今显得落后的画面[/h1]
毕竟是一款2006年推出游戏的HD重制版，画面细节方面的不足显而易见。剧情过场中人物的动作和表情略显僵硬。

[h1]-部分内容引导不完善[/h1]
地图中部分重要内容必须完成（没有特殊提示的）特定支线，或是细舔地图才能知道，关卡中部分剧情内容需要玩家自主前往相应地点，不甚友好。不过，大部分引导内容是很完善的。


这个已经出了5部作品的系列相信多数玩家还是有所耳闻的。初代丧尸围城与“丧尸无双”之名还相去甚远。[b]不仅是由于丧尸AI的攻击性较高，更重要的是完成任务的时间非常紧凑，想要做完主支线任务玩家必须分秒必争，毫无在丧尸堆里恋战的惬意[/b][spoiler]（然后疯狂SL）[/spoiler]。地图紧凑，隐藏线路和地下通道的设计也较为合理。想要从一代开始补该系列的玩家相信你不会失望，玩过之后作品的玩家也可以补一补Frank West的初代剧情。

[h1]以下是作为老司机给新手玩家的一些建议[/h1]

•游戏中1小时=现实5分钟，算入非强迫症玩家的SL时间和剧情时间，通关一个周目的用时大约是10个小时；

•[b]不玩主线CASE和精神病BOSS等于没玩[/b]；

•想要较为完整的体验游戏的内容至少需要两个周目，一周目熟悉地图，熟悉部分任务，积攒PP升级，二周目做完所有主支线任务，打出所有结局；
•另一种方案是只玩一周目打主线CASE和精神病BOSS通关，需要提前结合一下攻略，否则SL的时间还不如你使用上一种方案；
•一周目想完美通关？这就是我玩了五十多个小时的原因；

•务必要在地下通道找到紧急出口的钥匙，并通过完成支线任务Out Of Control来开启女厕所里的秘密通道；

•网上没有比较好的汉化补丁，本作英语不难，有一定基础的同学建议玩英文版；

•两篇我认为比较好的攻略文章，可作参考：

[url=http://bbs.a9vg.com/thread-613012-1-1.html]http://bbs.a9vg.com/thread-613012-1-1.html[/url]

35633803.review:
I love the sequels, but playing the first one in the series was pretty rough for me.

My biggest issue with the game is the boss design. Bosses can hit you so many times while you're down, and if you're not prepared with the best weapons and mixed drinks, they're not even worth attempting, and they just feel like they weren't designed with Frank's abilities in mind.

The game did actually grow on me the more I played it (solving the mystery in the story was cool), but as it more challenging, it just got more frustrating. The problem is that it's difficulty comes from manipulating a poorly-controlling character and maneuvering around incredibly fast boss attacks rather than simply relying on skill.

Also, this game has the ugliest mouths I've ever seen (I know it's old, but I think it's noteworthy)

35632104.review: To me Dead Rising is my perfect game, lots of exploration but with things to do. A set, and simple goal (to get out on the helicopter). A story and protagonist which are great and fun. Bosses that are diverse and play well. And an experience that changes every time you play it. There rarely zombie games that I like but this is the best IMO. Frank West controls well, the items work well and leveling up makes you actually feel like you level up rather than just getting new things. Voice acting is classic Capcom, survivors are dull but shortcuts make it easier. MAP is perfect THE PERFECT level design. You can play this over and over. Even then they give you 3 extra modes. Not to mention your level, costume, and unlockables carry over. There are plenty of secrets, moves, items and costumes you can get or unlock. This game HAS to be in your Library. I give this a game 5/5 (with a GOLD STAR CLASSIC tag)

35570381.review:
Frank West powraca w odświeżonej wersji po 10 latach.

Mamy tutaj do czynienia z tym samym tytułem co Capcom przygotował na platformie X360 w 2006 roku,ojciec marki Keiji Inafune postanowił odświeżyć pierwszą część produkcji na obecne platformy na rynku PC/PS4 oraz Xbox One.

Fabuła opowiada o losie prasowego fotografa Franka Westa który ląduje w środku centrum handlowego mieście Willamette jego zadaniem polega na odkryciu dlaczego stan Kolorado został zamknięty przez wojskową armię,oraz odnalezienie resztę ocalałych mając na to 72 godziny.

Pod względem rozgrywki jest to pełny sandboks z otwartym światem który liczy się dla nas czas,zerkając na zegarek naszego bohatera musimy mieć na oku rolę głównych misji w wyznaczonych godzinach sprawy,jest to dla nas obowiązek bez tego nie ruszymy dalej a przeszkadza nam jeszcze setka zombie nieumarłych.

Mając wolny czas od głównych misji po zwiedzaniu centrum handlowego dostajemy różne komunikaty o uwięzionych w różnych miejscach ocalałych kiedy dotrzemy do jednego z nich musimy zagwarantować lepsze miejsce jakim jest kryjówka nie ma problemu odprowadzić kilka osób na raz,ale pamiętajmy o tym kiedy zatnie lub zgubi nam się jedna z osób mogą zacząć się schody widząc na ekranie śmierć ocalałego nie dostając dodatkowych punktów PP do dotarciu kryjówki,ja osobiście miałem kilka takich sytuacji i myślałem że nie dam rady ale poznając teren za którymś razem wracając do poprzedniego zapisu udało się.

Od czasu do czasu możemy natrafić się na innych zwariowanych ocalałych,mowa o Psychopatach którzy grasują po całym centrum handlowym po pokonaniu jednego z nich możemy zabrać specjalną broń psychopacie którą używał przeciwko nam co owocuję lepsze przedostanie się hordom zombie.

Pierwsza część nie posiadała kombinacji broni tak samo jest z remasterem,dlatego musimy szukać po rozrzuconych lokacjach sklepowych kije bejsbolowe,pałki policyjne czy też specjalne ukryte bronie katana bądż pistolet maszynowy które bardzo szybko się kończą.

Po wykonywaniu zadań głównych i pobocznych dostajemy wspominane wcześniej punkty doświadczenia Prestige Points w celu wbijania postaci nowego poziomu dostajemy też za zabicie hordów zombie oraz fotografowaniu specjalnych zdjęć wzrastając jego zdrowie,większą ilość miejsc oraz mobilność szybkość poruszania się Franka z tym na początku możemy mieć problem ponieważ mając niski poziom postaci nie raz zdąrzymy kogoś uratować poruszając się jak żółw.

System zapisów pozostał bez zmian,grę możemy zapisać w kryjówce i toaletach różnych miejscach ale kiedy po ekranie śmierci zauważamy load game czy quit game lub nie zdążymy na czas do wyznaczonej misji możemy być tym sfrustrowani nie wiedząc w co się pakujemy,otóż jeśli chcemy wczytać zapis to wracamy tam kiedy zapisaliśmy grę,niestety nie ma autozapisów a jeżeli wybierzemy wyjść gry z zapisem,to cofie nas od początku z tym postępem co mieliśmy przed śmiercią grając wcześniej już NG+,trzeba mieć na to uwagę ponieważ mimo tylu lat twórcy nie wyjaśnili tej sytuacji.

Remaster w wersji na PC wygląda całkiem obiecująco lepsze kolory otoczenia i szczegółowe tekstury dzięki bibliotece DirectX 11 w kilku opcjach graficznych odróżnia się wiele od oryginału z przed lat,a optymalizacja jest całkiem dobrze zrobiona grając na maksymalnych ustawieniach nie uświadczyłem żadnych spadków masakrując kilkanaście zombie jednocześnie,pierwowzór jest dosyć poważnym tytułem stawiając na wysoki poziom survivalu od nowszych części serii Dead Rising,zdecydowanie wymagająca przez swój dawny klimat na rozgrywkę pozostawiający bez zmian.

Według Mnie :
8/10

+
Remaster
Optymalizacja
Poziom Trudności
Szybkie Loadingi
Kilka Zakończeń

-
Powtarzalna
Sterowanie
Bugi

It's like Fatal Frame invaded a zombie game and also infuriated players with weapon durability 10+ years before Breath of the Wild and also infuriated players more with survivor AI 30 times worse than Left 4 Dead's survivor AI and then decided to turn the wackyness dial up to 8, but not 11, because this isn't exactly Saint's Row 3/4, by having stupid outfits to wear and wacky ways to kill off zombies, while also adding psychopathic bosses to kill which vaguely remind me of some of the bosses from No More Heroes, in that they're psychotic, wacky, and a damage sponge.

So in short: Kill zombies, bosses, rescue survivors, and take photographs, all which give experience that level you up and increase your weapon/item stock, health, damage, throw distance, or learn new skills. You can also focus on the game's story missions, and like everything else, it's on a time constraint, or you could just ignore everything and dick around in the mall to your heart's content.

The game is mostly fun, although it can get very frustrating at times, like escorting the brain dead survivors, simply avoiding crowds of zombies to get from point A to B, traversing the cartoonishly overpopulated maintenance tunnels, or fighting that motorcycle boss that can eat a dick as well as a proper boss design document.
