30142112.review:
A game that you should absolutely give a shot. The amount of polish is incredible, it's immoderately satisfying to bash your way through the mobs of zombies, and... well, just about every part of this game holds up excellently. That being said, there are a few flaws.

The  animations are... well, not great. They're not bad, by any means, but somewhat stiff and unrealistic. The graphics are better than the original, but not as good as they potentially could be.
The AI is laughable. That's the best word to describe it. Survivors seem to have no sense of self-preservation, psychopaths confuse themselves a lot, and zombies... well, it's hard to describe, but they seem to have specific AI flaws that you can consistently take strategic advantage of. That may just be intentional, though.

When this game is only $20 and the abomination that is DR4 goes for $60, you KNOW you have to go with this game. We must make Capcom aware that we want more games like this, not soulless cash grabs made by inhuman monsters (AKA Canadians).

...I'm sorry, that was meant as a joke. But seriously, buy this game.

30137545.review:
Important stuff first, rambling and shambling to follow......
The game is basically....
[b] Story [/b] = Ho hum, classic shambling zombies that will swarm you in packs. Interesting enough to keep you engaged
[b] Setting [/b] = Brilliant! A shopping mall and a very nice shopping mall to boot. The open world isn't as huge as most open world games but heck, this is a perfectly sized shopping mall for this game.
[b] Gameplay [/b] = This encompasses a lot. The combat system is...awkward. I mean, I'd rather use weapons than try and pull of some fancy wrestling move only to be swarmed by 3-4 zombies. The only thing I found helpfull was the flying kick, followed by a roundhouse as I landed, a perfect way to open up for my flurry of sword/dagger/bat swings. 
A suplex? A hammer throw? Wall jump kick? I pretty much got eaten alive by the time I could pull these moves off. This is not Batman, there is no freeflow combat....that's exactly what this game needed to make the hand to hand combat perfect.....zombies dont think too quickly though. 
The guns are a little better ( headshots work well ), if somewhat limited. 
Don't get me started on the survivor/escorts AI.....There are ample comments about how much more stupid the "living" are than the zombies. 

Taking photo's is an afterthought eventually....
Some very entertaining moments!

So, you really need to put in a little work and try to understand HOW this game works before you get some enjoyment out of it. 

Now my 10 cents....

Because of the stupid amount of games I have on steam, I've started to get through them all with a specific system. 

Firstly, decide on a game to play (a no brainer), then dedicate a good 2-3 hours to it. Secondly, if I'm not having fun (because games are supposed to be fun), quit it, delete, leave a negative review but with constructive criticism and put the game in my hidden list. Thirdly, if it's a game I'm enjoying, play it through and repeat the steps.

Funny thing about this game, I got to step 2, hated the game then thought " I'm missing something here...there has to be more of a point to this...". I went into Dead rising without knowing too much about it, expecting something like State of decay or Dead island with a combat system that made you feel badass. I didn't get what I was expecting....

You have to dig a bit deeper to enjoy this game, it's not a jump in and bash the crap out of everything game, though you can do that eventually, you don't do it from the get go. There are things you have to understand before you can get to the point of feeling like a badass....

For starters, you have to understand this game is based on a "triage" system when it comes to completing a "scoop" or "case file". You are timed in missions but not so much that you're overwhelmed and frustrated. 
Secondly, you have to understand the save system. You can save the game in certain areas only and to a number of different slots. However, anytime you die and save to start again, you have all of your stats and character progress intact! This opens up a hell of a lot of possibilities. The level cap (of 50 I think), can easily be reached in one playthrough. 

If you're at the party looking for the hot girl/guy who's saying all the right things to you and making it so easy for you to take her home....You're at the wrong party or left your invite in your golfer pants. 
Now, if you happen to be at the party where the BBW is kinda awkwardly dancing without co-ordination and she's a bit loud but she's got a  gorgeous face and is giving you the eye, then you NEED to go chat with her, understand her, invite her out for a date, don't care what other poeple think and you'll discover that there's a lot more going on. Itmaybelikethisgame! Might just be the game for you....errr...silly analogy but I'm partial to BBW's.....

30050160.review:
This game is a classic. Released back in 2006 as what felt like a third party launch title for the Xbox 360, Dead Rising has had a great transition over to Steam in August of 2016 as a part of its 10th Anniversary. It feels great to play on either a Controller or a Mouse and Keyboard, and while it has some dated aspects such as aiming a gun with the left stick when you aim or the stiff mouth movements in cutscenes, it doesnt hurt the experience much at all. The game, while fun, has some pretty big balancing issues, primarily the Small Chainsaw (which Capcom should never nerf). If you gather 2 books from the Bookstore underneath Columbian Roastmasters in Paradise Plaza (The Engineering and the Entertainment books) and then went over to Sir Book-a-lot in Wonderland Plaza and grabbed the Criminal Biography book, it lasts for about 27,000 swings, which is about the entire game. Also, some of the achievements are very annoying to get, mostly the 5 and 7 Day Survivor, Saint, and Transmissionary achievements. They are brutal and require you to know EXACTLY what you're doing.

 Other than that, the story is servicable and some people call the best in the series, though I prefer Dead Rising 2's story. The combat is one of the more fun things in this game like performing the special moves which are unlockable by, wait for it --- leveling up. Doing stuff like rescuing survivors (which have the worst AI known to man and made me want to claw my eyes out), completing scoops, case files and defeating Psychopaths gives you experience, where you can max out your level to level 50. Beware though, driving in this game is AWFUL and if you can avoid it, please do so. Frank is a good character, and to me hes just plain awesome. Another unique aspect is that you can also get rewarded for mixing food in blenders, like if you put a Coffee Creamer along with another food, lets say Orange Juice, you will get Quickstep, which makes you run like Sonic in the middle of a bathroom emergency for a short period of time. This game is incredibly hard to 100% though, so beware of that. To sum up what I said, while it doesnt have co-op or a true sandbox mode, if you can forgive that --- its the definition of old but gold.

29724631.review: Deadrising was originally released on the xbox360 and at the time proved that vast zombie hordes were capable of being rendered with good graphics. The controls made sense even though being forced to stand in one place to aim was frustrating at times it still made sense due to the fact that frank even states he has never fired a weapon at someone before in the intro chapters. The AI for the humans was more than irritating though. And unless you knew exactly what to do many of the psychos were nigh impossible without tons and tons of food. This PC variant doesn't state that it is a remastering of the original even though it is and improves upon many aspects of the original game. The Graphics have improved quite drastically if you do a side by side comparison. The AI has also improved(more so for the zombies than the humans) the psychos react more appropriately to combat and the humans follow commands better. However I find that there are several human survivors more interested in sobbing in the center of a horde of zombies than fighting or following orders(can be a minimal issue with the help of a magazine that improves survivor confidence). It also seems as though all dlc is included and controller support is fully functional. The story for this thing is not entirely required to complete the game but I highly recommend playing through the story as it can be pretty interesting compared to most zombie games. The story pushes you to do things quickly so pathway flow from survivor to survivor to psycho to safe house can and is very important(be sure to plan ahead and map your route). The variety of weapons, toys, abilities, and costumes is almost unrivaled only to its sequels(some special costumes grant powerful abilities or weapons as well). There is also drivable vehicles though very few. In conclusion I highly recommend this game and I thoroughly enjoyed playing through it again.

Considering this game was set to release back in 2005, it was definitely ahead of its time. It's a very unique gaming experience that is a testament to how creative and innovative Capcom once was. I'd never played this game until now and I'm wishing I'd gotten it back in the Xbox 360 days and enjoyed it sooner. That being said, this is a pretty good port. The controller support is great, the animations and voice-acting from the cinematics really hold up. In fact, everything about this game holds up great, the only thing that is out of place today is the high difficulty and the horrible AI for both the survivors and psychopaths. I did run into some framerate issues with 2x crossfire 290x's, which I'm guessing is probably just an AMD thing (I've come to accept that most of the time, that's all it is), because even thought I play this game in 4k and it runs perfect otherwise, whenever too many zombies are on screen, it drops down to below 30 frames even when I drop the resolution and graphical settings as low as they can go (and I have a n i7 4790k so I doubt it's a cpu issue).
Now that I've beaten the game and gotten the true ending, I'm wishing there was a mod that added a true sandbox mode instead of the regular Infinite Mode.

29316614.review:
[h1]Aged like milk[/h1]

Dead Rising is one of the most dated games I have ever beaten. If you've never played this game before, stay away. This game is loaded with clunky relics that would immediately turn you off from a contemporary game.

Aiming with a gun glues your feet in place
Weapons are as durable as paper mache
Re-collecting the same uzi and katana every time you leave the spawn room is tedious and a chore
Endless backtracking
Escort missions 
Timed escort missions
Extremely poor AI pathfinding that makes timed escort missions a nightmare from hell
Clunky melee
Underwhelming final boss fights
Even more zombies on the PC release than the original due to hardware limitations
More zombies means more pointless bullet sponges
Zombies pop back in when you're not looking 
Zero attempt at balancing the game
You can start the game over with your current level if you die 
Atrocious writing
"Hey Niko let's go bowling" but ten times worse
Picking up the receiver to address these messages robs you from being able to run, jump, attack, and if you are attacked the message starts over AGAIN FROM THE BEGINNING. 


Dead Rising is a video game icon from multiple generations ago. There's a ton of unique personality from the vibrant cast of literal crazies out to kill you. I love the call backs to Capcom's other franchises. The photography gimmick is loads of fun and there are plenty of hilarious ways to kill zombies Within five minutes of the game you're given a prime chance to cut down a huge cloud of them with a lawn mower.

Even so. it is absolutely not worth enduring this game's shortcomings to squeeze out the few droplets of quality that shine to this day. Go ahead and look at the positive reviews. They're loaded with insults. Rose-tinted glasses bind old fans from fully realizing this game is not worth playing outside of nostalgia.

As a big fan of Dead Rising 2, I knew I had to pick this up.
First let me just say that this is a fine good port. There are a lot of glichy ports of older games and it's a breath of fresh air to see how smoothly this game plays on newer systems. The controls take a little getting use to, the countdown clock is a source of stress and great achivement, and the AI for the surviors is a mess. But I love this game. 29087564.review:
[code]我是一个丧尸战地记者
我救的幸存者越多，就越觉得还是丧尸脑子好使
我喜欢的妹子，一个成了系列反派，一个只有在外传才能续命
我以为我已经心如铁石，直到一位身穿低胸黑色礼裙+渔网袜的女士躺下叫我拍照，我才发现
我其实是身如铁石
[strike]色[/strike]摄影，摄影从未改变[/code]

[h1]2006年初代《丧尸围城》重制版：戏谑不羁的道具玩法，除了续作之外，在当今丧尸游戏业界中依然无出其右[/h1]

国际上流传着一个笑话：千万不要把成龙放进一个家具城里面

因为这位奥斯卡终身成就奖得主的作品特色之一就是极其擅长将场景中的各种物品富有创意和笑点地编排进打戏之中——凡是拿得动的东西，就等着被那个大鼻子打坏吧

就是这样一句警世良言，威廉米特镇的丧尸们却一直把它当做脑余肉后的笑谈，直到弗兰克·韦斯特空降一间大型超市之后，他们才终于回想起一度被家具支配的恐怖……

丧尸围城1没有续作的道具合成功能，所以道具玩起来可能没有那么疯狂或者花哨。不过，如果是初次接触丧尸围城的话，系列一贯的脑洞特色与黑色幽默相信是不会让阁下失望的。闲暇的时候，在超市到处逛逛，尝试一下250余种武器的用途，可能会在意想不到的时候收获一些让人咯咯傻笑的乐趣。

举几个栗子：
① 油漆桶、口红棒等物品可以在丧尸身上留下颜色；
② 小熊头套、马头套之类的物品，长按攻击键可以把它们戴在丧尸或者NPC(据说可以)的头上；
③ 食用油、香水、宠物食品等物品扔在地上可以让丧尸滑倒；
④ 断手、洗发剂等物品可以塞在丧尸嘴里，让其失去攻击性；
⑤铁管投掷在丧尸身上可以将其放血致"死"，祭祀剑可以发动跳劈
……

总而言之，丰富多样、看似合理实际脱线的道具玩法是我心目中丧尸围城系列最值得推荐的乐趣。

[h1]让人又爱又恨的支线任务[/h1]

我从来都不喜欢丧尸围城的限时任务设定。当你已经能熟练地救出50+幸存者的时候，掐准时间做任务能带来一种刺激感和满足感。但是如果你是一周目，想救人又不愿意提前看攻略的话，难免会错失支线任务，或者是反复读档只求跑快一点，这样真的很有挫败感。所以我就干脆放弃了在一周目折磨自己，随缘玩，直到后来二周目和三周目才开始看攻略救人。

4代取消了限时任务，我觉得是明智的，这样可以让玩家即使在一周目也能够享受自由游玩的乐趣，而不是满世界赶路做任务。

抛开限时来说，支线任务本身还算有意思，尤其是可以救很多幸存者。

[h1]稳如智障的NPC[/h1]

我一直都说，只有在丧尸题材里面，人类才显得特别地值得珍惜。

因为在其他天灾人祸中，幸存者要面临的只是失去人类同伴的悲痛无助或者遇到人类敌人的惊惶不安，但是丧尸危机会把人类变为非人，刚刚还一起谈过心的同类，转眼就成了不问是非只求血肉的活尸，这足以让正常人在见到活人时油然而生一种宽慰感。

玩过这么多丧尸游戏，《丧尸围城》是唯一一个把拯救幸存者任务作为主要游戏内容的丧尸游戏。——听起来好像很光明，然而丧尸围城1的NPC实在是令人发指地智障！

支线幸存者们就几句语音台词，还要不断地重复，这其实还可以忍受，但是他们哭起来就真是蠢得让人抓狂了，尤其是女NPC的哭声，要不是我要做50人全救的成就，我早就掏出枪打爆她们的头[spoiler]或者塞进她们喉咙里[/spoiler]了

还有，AI的设计人员就应该被拖出去被女丧尸咬断！——我玩一周目的时候说的最多的话就是“快点！” “过来！” “智障！”

NPC走得慢被旁边的丧尸抓住就算了，有的NPC你让他待在一个地方，自己去附近办点事，结果一走开他就自己乱跑进丧尸堆了！NPC的路径选择相当弱智，转向的时候经常要停顿一下，在拐角处或者有高度差的地方特别容易被卡住，尤其是倒地的盆栽，搞得我还要跑回去循循善诱。而且完全不会排队，来到通往安全室的通风管口之前要爬一下，结果经常有两个或以上的幸存者面对面原地跑，不给对方留出转身调整好角度爬上来的空间，我只好跳下去把他们推开，赶着做任务的时候真的炒鸡火大。

好吧，要玩下去的话只能适应游戏而已，容易被丧尸围住那我就用小丑电锯或者蜂后开路，容易迷路我就尽量选开阔的路走，虽然辛苦点，但是爸爸我总不能丢下这些智障儿女不管啊。

讲道理，有些时候幸存者还是有点用的，比如主角在背着幸存者（或者扶着走和牵着手走）的时候，丧尸会显著降低扑过来把你抓住的倾向，所以可以轻松地穿过尸群，不用停下来开路或者不停大跳了。如果幸存者拿了武器，在靠得近的情况下，他们会帮被丧尸抓住的主角解围，虽然经常会造成友伤。

我对大多数幸存者没什么好感，除了一些知道感激的妹子。我最讨厌的NPC是不停打来骚扰电话的Otis大爷，这个死老头总是不分场合来电，根本不管你是正在躲避尸群还是打boss战。
Cheryl是第一个也是唯一一个让我觉得“这个人没白救”的幸存者，因为她会在第3日晚上8点左右要求主角去给她拍艳照……要不下次只救她一个好了

[h1]关于拯救50+幸存者（剧透预警）[/h1]

[olist]
    [*]可以在笔记本里查看幸存者的信息和人数，除去主角弗兰克之外，一共有53位幸存者可以救
    [*]网上攻略没有提到的是，枪店里面的3个隐藏幸存者会在Case 7-2（拆弹事件）之后消失，所以一定要提前去找他们
    [*]在主线任务Case 2-3，在超市打败Steven之后不去拿药，可以救出51人，Brad和Jessie救出，Isabela妹子和Simone没有逃离
    [*]做完Case 5-2之后，不要回安全室接下一个任务，主线将失败，继续游戏，可以救出52人，Isabela妹子救出，Simone死亡
    [*]做完Case 7-2之后，不要回安全室接下一个任务（如果接了那么Isabela会外出），最后可以救出51人， Barnaby博士和Brad死亡，Isabela和Simone救出
    [*]以上三种做法，直升机驾驶员Ed DeLuca都会存活，但他不计算入53人中。
    [*]要救Simone，Barnaby博士必死，因为只有做了Case 5-2之后的主线任务，弗兰克才会得知关于病毒的真相，才能劝说Simone去安全室。Brad必死（拆弹后被丧尸咬死），因为Simone后期会给一个任务，要求给她一把手枪，否则她会离开。要完成这个任务，前提是完成Case 7-2。
[/olist]

[h1]什么？你问重制版重制了什么？[/h1]

[list]
    [*]画面高清化，有些地方甚至比2代更好。
    [*]收录了所有DLC服装。
[/list]
就这么多。捉鸡的AI、不方便的存档点都还是十年前的味道，Bug也有点多。

[h1]我其实是比较喜欢生存恐怖类型的丧尸游戏，单纯的丧尸无双对我没有很大吸引力，不过《丧尸围城》紧凑的支线任务和有趣的道具玩法让我开始路转粉（说来还有敖厂长视频的功劳）。

如果你玩过2代的话，就会发现1代其实“硬核”很多：丧尸反应比2代快、容易把人抱住；幸存者会怕丧尸，AI相当差劲。不过可能是被虐得多了，我现在反而觉得2代不该太简单QvQ[/h1]

对了，我很喜欢1代的拍照功能。


By 凱風
二零一七年一月七日

28966071.review:
Never thought I would be able to play this. I had seen some videos about it when it was an xbox exclusive, but I never had an xbox 360. 

There was a Wii spinoff, which I did not try because back then I was not interested in the series. Just like with other game misunderstandings of how the game was or how it played. 
Years later, I had read and heard good stuff on a remixed version of the sequel, Dead Rising 2 Off The Record. I rented the PS3 version and... 
Honestly? I loved it.
The humor,  the design philosophy that was similar to Breath of Fire V, where you are not lost if you lose, but you get to try again, the limits it had.
And the sandbox mode it added. That was important.
Off The Record was my first experience with Dead Rising. And it was enough to make me a fan of the series. OR  at least a fan of that particular entry.

Afterwards I ctually LOOKED at how this played, I saw videos, I saw a good LP of it (http://lparchive.org/Dead-Rising/). I started to understand what was done for OTR and why.

And then I started getting the entire series on Steam. Or at least I did this year. 
Dead Rising 2 OTR is  CONSIDERABLY more accessible. The first Dead Rising is VERY strict about what it does and what it wants. The timing to rescue the survivors in the first game is much  more strict than it is in the sequels, but that is how it goes.
The first game is  very strict.  Dead Rising 2 eased up the  requirements, even though it  added  a bit more complication with the zombrex, but it was looser, as well as adding new things, like combination  weapons.
Off The Record did it again there, and even more, added a mode where the  time limit is REMOVED. The Sandbox mode.

Dead Rising 3 removed the photography, which is an element I GREATLY enjoyed in OTR and in this one, but made it more accessible, as well as making the weapon combination more important and flexible, but the focus on having to save survivors and managing a strict time table was made completely optional. It is still a very fun game but  what made the first game so special was diluted by then.
On the other hand, that does not make me like it any less. Since I started with one that was  MUCH more  flexible. 

Dead Rising 4 seems to have removed all of that. Seems like its design is a much expanded  Sandbox mode from OTR.
I will be getting that when it gets on Steam.

This is a very strict game.
It is nowhere as accessible as its sequels.
But it is a very interesting experience with a good sense of humor.

And you get to dress up Frank/Chuck/Nick/Frank again with a Servbot helmet, I guess.

28841107.review:
Dead Rising, originally an Xbox 360 release title (well, around that time at least) was a zombie game before the zombie craze went off the rails. Nowadays we have co-op campaigns like Left 4 Dead to apocalpyse survival games like H1Z1. But Dead Rising (along with Resident Evil to an extent, where the focus was less on zombies and more on horror) is where it all started and it's influence is absolutely felt in every zombie game today regardless of whether or not you played it. It's intelligent game design and time based gameplay make for an extremely challenging and fun experience where gameplay decisions and skill come hand in hand. 

You play Frank West, a photojournalist trying to uncover a strange ongoing mystery happening at a mall in a place called Williamette, a town somewhere in Colorado. He's covered wars you know, so he organizes a helicopter pickup 3 days after he is dropped off in which he'll enravel the mystery that is going on and learn the dark secret of what is causing the zombie outbreak and make his escape. 

As far as stories go, it's as Japanese as you would expect. The lipsync quite frankly is terrible, and you can tell English was a second thought and no effort was made to try and fix this. It's definitely immersion breaking at times but the voice acting here is surprisingly pretty good. The actual mystery itself is pretty compelling and has, while not subtle at all, a pretty disturbingly true message about first world countries and human consumption. The psychopaths that you meet along the way (boss fights) are again, surprisingly intriguing. They all have a specific way of fighting meaning you have to adjust your playstyle slightly in order to combat them which can be quite tricky if you aren't prepared. What's most surprising is the in which these psychopaths are humanized, making you feel sorry for killing them. Cliff especially has a pretty sad story along with one or two others. Of course, there are genuine crazy people who do crazy things because they're crazy but I personally feel that there should have been more emotionally moving psychopaths as opposed to insane people who act in anger for no reason.

As for gameplay, like I mentioned in the beginning of the interview, time is everything. You really need to manage your time effectively if you want to be able to save all the survivors and unravel the mystery of the outbreak which for most people causes the most frustration. Personally, I think these people are misunderstanding why that is such a good mechanic, it forces you to learn the paths of the mall, where the food is, where the best weapons are, what's the best way to approach a case and so on. Dead Rising is a game MEANT to be played more than once. You will succeed, then fail, but you  will always learn from your mistakes. I think the complaints are from people who just need to, quite honestly, git gud. That being said, the things this game does wrong are quite bad.

The worst, without a doubt for me, is the AI. The AI half the time get caught on stupid pieces of terrain or stop moving after defending themselves from a zombie attack. Infact, the AI is SO BAD that it's actually easier to carry the injured survivors through a horde of zombies than an able bodied one wielded with a gun because they will not be able to run past all the zombies and rush to the saferoom without getting attacked or failing to defend themselves. This is where the game shows it's age, as well as in the shooting controls. The shooting controls are simiarly like Resident Evil 4, except funnily enough, less clunky as you can move a full 360 degrees which you can't do reliably in Resi 4 without turning your character the whole way. 

That said, even with the frustrating AI, the game is still a lot of fun. The amount of weapons in the game is insane for a game made in 2006. It has more weapons than Left 4 Dead 2 for christ sake, although not all of those weapons are neccesarily 'good', but they are actual weapons that can be used.  There's just something hilariously unique about shoving a horse head mask on a zombie then using a bowling ball to 'strike' them down. All the survivors have different personalities and while they can be annoying to escort at times, it's really satisfying getting a group of survivors to the safehouse and be rewarded for it. What's great is that you can get through the game just fine ignoring them at all but the game makes you feel guilty with it's bright red 'JASON SMITH HAS DIED' in big bold red writing as well as their screams for help that you can't help but feel you have to. The game rewards you with PP (haha pp...ugh) which is basically XP that let's Frank level up and improves how fast he walks, how much damage he does and how many items he can carry. 

One of the most unique things to the character of Frank West is that he's a photojournalist, which means you'll be taking pictures of the events that happen. Certain specific moments like two family members reuniting can give you a ton of PP if you manage to snap a moment of it at the right moment as well as more perverted photos like taking a picture of a zombie womans cleavage (god damn it Japan). These don't feel gimickly at all and it flows really nicely. I found myself taking pictures of things that wouldn't neccesarily give me a lot of PP but I would take them anyway because I thought the image was just super cool.

With that all being said, Dead Rising is a fun game that sometimes requires you to wrestle with the mechanics a little but is absolutely worth it's price in challenge, story and exploration. It's a game made 10 years ago that is still miles ahead of games being released today, as pathetic as that is. If you're looking for a game that challenges your timing and skill or if you're just looking to see how zombie games got started, this is definitely a game you want to pick up.

28776529.review:
Surprisingly innovative for a game from 2006, Dead Rising® is basically ''Time® Management®: The® Game®''. Or more adequately, ''Escort® Missions®: The® Game®''

An entire game consisting of escort missions rightfully gained the ire of some people that gave this a shot back in '06. The escortee's sometimes have their pathing screwed up and get stuck behind a wall; they can't navigate the hordes as easily aas you can, which means as little as 10 zombies can stop their movement; some move somewhat slow -- there's nothing more obnoxious than seeing them 6 miles away from you as you turn around to check up on them.

It doesn't help that the VERY FIRST escort mission in the game is QUITE POSSIBLY the hardest one, which means a lot of people probably rage quit this game back in the day. Add to that the fact that you have a set amount of time to get these survivors and escort them, as well as doing main storyline missions and some people probably grew exhasperated at such constraints.

But that's a misunderstanding of how the game was designed.

For one thing: the game is constantly on a timer that constantly ticks down, even during boss fights. How much real world time does the game have? 

6 hours. 

This is a 6 hour long game. And all of your upgrades from one playthrough carry over to the next. Upgrades like improved walkspeed (CRUCIAL) to attack strength and life-meter. Additionally, upon death you can save and restart the game, or reload. 

In other words, the game is made in such a way so as to allow you to get right back to where you previously where. It's meant to be replayed, wherein the game becomes much easier due to upgrades. granted, you CAN save all people in a single playthrough and the only difficult escort mission is the first one, so replays aren't necessary. But missing something  and restarting isn't as obnoxious as you might think since you can get right back to where you where in less than 3 hours.

Tell anyone this game is 6 hours long and they'll probably scoff, because it feels much longer and bigger than that. Every mission, including escort missions, are on a timer. You typically get a slew of them with each ''chapter'', and some come in the middle of said chapters. They're all neatly lined up on your screen with their timers displayed; it's all a matter of rushing to save people and bringing them back to the safe room whilst having time to also continue the main storyline. 

With so much running about the game feels much longer than it actually is. The sense of accomplishment in seeing the survivors pile up in the safe rooms is immense. You can completely ignore survivors if you want, but there's really nothing more to the game other than rescuing survivors and doing the story mode. It's all the more exciting if you're juggling time, otherwise the story itself is really easy and you'll never miss any mission.

At it's core Dead Rising is a game meant to be replayed. If you don't want to replay the game for whatever reason: you can play for an hour or so and purposefully let the zombies kill you, then commence once more with knowledge of the malls layout and your experience poitns carrying over. The main goal isn't necessarily completing the story, as that isn't hard. It's getting all the survivors along with the previous goal-Dead Rising is a completionists game. It's short enough to make replays not feel like a chore to get back to where you were, but has a lot going on so as to surprise you when you realize you reached where you previously were in under 6 hours.

A first playthrough will probably take over 8 or so hours, and thats because of reloads to better manage time. But subsequent playthroughs will most likely take under 6 hours.

Overall A++. There are some flaws in how the ai for the escorts is programmed, but otherwise it's not a big deal and overall highly enjoyable.

28261459.review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a full review, and NOT a first impressions review like all my other reviews, if you want a better full review, then please read better reviews then mine [/h1]

Dead Rising is a game developed and published by Capcom. Think Saints Row, both game series are silly in their own ways. With Dead Rising, you have the main character, Frank West who's just a normal person trying to report an apocalypse, you have a number of fun weapons and clothes to try out, you have the camera system which helps you in levelling up slightly

With the levelling system present, the game allows you to start a new game using your progress from your previous save, making the game much easier for you, especially to complete the side-missions and defeat psychopaths

The day/night cycle makes the world feel real rather than constantly having the game at night just because it's a zombie game. It also gives challenge to the player, to either stay inside the shelter and wait out night time or to risk going out at night having to deal with stronger zombies but with a potentially more rewarding experience

There is a wide variety of weapons to choose from in the game. The game allows you to change Frank's clothing, though in order to do so you'd need to explore the mall and try out the outfits that are available to be worn, in some of the stores

The combat is not terrible, just that I felt it wasn't very smooth and fluid. Trying to aim with a weapon can be difficult especially since you're not able to move when you're aiming the gun or to throw a weapon. Fighting against psychopaths, especially when you're still starting the game can be very frustrating

The Survivor AI is just terrible, you encounter survivors who say they want to live but as you try to escort them and look back, they're often standing still or running slowly as if they want to be eaten alive. You can give them a weapon for their self-defense but it's not like they'll be able to use it effectively. It's infuriating but pretty satisfying when you're actually able to escort at least two or more at once to the shelter though

The waypoint system is sort of a triangle, you're at point A, you want to reach to point C without looking at the map so you trust the waypoint system to lead you there, so you keep following the waypoint until you realise it made you take a detour through point B even though the risk of going straight to point C or taking the detour is more or less the same, just that you wasted an amount of time because of the waypoint system. Seriously, you're better off navigating on your own using the map. It's as if it was designed to waste the player's time as much as possible. Once you've played enough of the game you'll probably remember all the locations of the mall anyway.

Dead Rising has a time limit system for the missions, in which you only have a limited amount of time to complete missions. You're able to ignore the missions but with consequences, you might lose survivors when skipping side missions and you won't be able to continue playing the main mission if you skip them. However, you're still able to continue on playing freeroam after skipping and failing the main mission

Dead Rising can be quite challenging, especially with the lack of difficulty choices, save locations and the stupid survivor AI, however it is a great start to a fantastic zombie series!

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

28158419.review:
My first two entries into the Dead Rising series were Dead Rising 2 and Dead Rising 2: Off the Record, though I've never actually finished any of them. I've never played the original Dead Rising on the Xbox 360 so this Dead Rising remaster on the PC will be my first time playing it.

[b]Good[/b]:
👍 [b][i]Silliness[/i][/b]:
Think Saints Row, both game series are silly in their own ways. With Dead Rising, you have the main character, Frank West who's just a normal person trying to report an apocalypse, you have a number of fun weapons and clothes to try out, you have the camera system which helps you in levelling up slightly. Of course, like Saints Row, the game can be serious at times.
👍 [b][i]Replay Value[/i][/b]:
With the levelling system present, the game allows you to start a new game using your progress from your previous save, making the game much easier for you, especially to complete the side-missions and defeat psychopaths you didn't manage to do in your first playthrough. You can play "freeroam" to level up Frank and start a new game with that progress when you feel ready to do the missions. You can also unlock the sandbox mode '∞ Mode'.
👍 [b][i]Day/Night Cycle[/i][/b]:
The day/night cycle makes the world feel real rather than constantly having the game at night just because it's a zombie game. It also gives challenge to the player, to either stay inside the shelter and wait out night time or to risk going out at night having to deal with stronger zombies but with a potentially more rewarding experience.
👍 [b][i]Weapon Variety[/i][/b]:
There is a wide variety of weapons to choose from in the game. I lost count after picking up twenty-five different ones. My favourite weapons would probably be the Sickle and Excavator, no regrets going into that hardware store out of curiosity.
👍 [b][i]Character Customisation[/i][/b]:
The game allows you to change Frank's clothing, though in order to do so you'd need to explore the mall and try out the outfits that are available to be worn, in some of the stores.

[b]Bad[/b]:
👎 [b][i]Combat[/i][/b]:
It's not terrible, just that I felt it wasn't very smooth and fluid. Trying to aim with a weapon can be difficult especially since you're not able to move when you're aiming the gun or to throw a weapon. Fighting against psychopaths, especially when you're still starting the game can be very frustrating. Maybe it's not the bad combat, maybe I'm just bad at the game, who knows.
👎 [b][i]Survivor AI[/i][/b]:
Terrible, you encounter survivors who say they want to live but as you try to escort them and look back, they're often standing still or running slowly as if they want to be eaten alive. You can give them a weapon for their self-defense but it's not like they'll be able to use it effectively. It's infuriating but pretty satisfying when you're actually able to escort at least two or more at once to the shelter though. Kindell was the best survivor I've encountered in the game though.
👎 [b][i]Waypoint System[/i][/b]:
Imagine a triangle, you're at point A, you want to reach to point C without looking at the map so you trust the waypoint system to lead you there, so you keep following the waypoint until you realise it made you take a detour through point B even though the risk of going straight to point C or taking the detour is more or less the same, just that you wasted an amount of time because of the waypoint system. Seriously, you're better off navigating on your own using the map. It's as if it was designed to waste the player's time as much as possible. Once you've played enough of the game you'll probably remember all the locations of the mall anyway.
👎 [b][i]Audio Panning[/i][/b]:
There were numerous times when a survivor would be crying right in front of me and I'd only hear them from the right side of my headphones as if they were to the right of my character. I don't know if it's just me or it really is the game.

[b]Notes[/b]:
👌 [b][i]Time limit[/i][/b]:
Dead Rising has a time limit system for the missions, in which you only have a limited amount of time to complete missions. You're able to ignore the missions but with consequences, you might lose survivors when skipping side missions and you won't be able to continue playing the main mission if you skip them. However, you're still able to continue on playing freeroam after skipping and failing the main mission. Initially, I wasn't the biggest fan of this when I first tried out the Dead Rising series but then as I played more, my opinion changed in favour of it, especially since it's one of the features that makes Dead Rising unique compared to other open-world sandbox zombie games.
👌 [b][i]Challenge[/i][/b]:
The game can be quite challenging, especially with the lack of difficulty choices, save locations and the stupid survivor AI. 
👌 The chances of having a perfect playthrough, with all side-missions completed, psychopaths killed and survivors saved, on the first try is very slim. The game was designed with replayability in mind, with each playthrough you do, everything becomes easier because of the progress system works. With this in mind, I would not recommend this game for those who are looking to have a perfect playthrough on their first try, you will fail and you will be retrying numerous times.
👌 [b][i]Miscellaneous[/i][/b]:
	1. The convicts on the humvee in Leisure Park can be annoying especially after you've already beaten them the first time. (The music too.)
	2. You can sometimes get stuck in the 'jumping animation' when you try to jump on some cramped locations.
	3. Otis' messages being unskippable without losing side-missions is very annoying.

It's a shame Dead Rising 4 will not feature most, if not all of the things I liked about Dead Rising.

Your results will be even worse because now they'll just target any zombie whether close or far and waste more precious time. 

(-) Zombie capacity increase. This was something I noticed right away. It appears the amount of zombies have been doubled or even tripled in certain areas making escourting survivors even more challenging. Stocking up on quickstep barely helps avoiding confrontations because it doesn't last long enough. I understand this is a zombie game and all but this was not how the Xbox 360 version was. The Xbox 360 version couldn't possibly have these amount of zombies due to hardware limitations but on PC the amounts are just ridiculous. Even veteran players like myself struggle to complete missions with enough time. It's only logical that if the amount of zombies were increased so should the intelligence of the survivors. 

(-) No indicator to determine the quality of your weapons. This was never in the Xbox 360 version but thought it should have been included in the remastered version. When you attack zombies your weapons gradually begin to get weaker eventually breaking. There should have been a percentage bar under each weapon showing how much is left. This would enable the player to have more strategy in fights. 

(-) Long dialogue with survivors. In order to have survivors team up you must first interact with them. The amount of dialogue there is before the survivor joins is way too long. There should have been an ability to speed past the dialogue to avoid sneaky zombies from attacking you from behind or even the survivor. 



Conclusion 
----------------
I personally love Dead Rising. I still believe this game is and will always be the best but this applies to the Xbox 360 version not PC. The gradual changes that have been applied have modified this game making it something different then what it once was. If you truly want the best experience play the Xbox 360 version.

28129487.review:
In 2006, Dead Rising was a technical achievement and the sole reason I bought an Xbox 360. It felt like something familiar, but still like something I hadn't played yet. This game has a silly tone to start, but quickly shifts into horror as soon as the malls automated power is cut after close. The atmosphere alone is one to be experienced first hand. By yesteryear's standard, the graphics were goofy, sure, but some of the best I had seen a video game offer on a console. Couldn't read the text too well, but ooh what's that sound? It sounds so good! Hearing glass shattering, the difference in running machines, each slice, dice and every single drop of blood hitting the floor, I can honestly say that this is easily one of the best sounding video games I've ever played. I'm still basking in the aural pool of it's warm waves. 

	But of course the most significant feature was rendering six hundred plus characters on screen at one time without massive dips in frame rate or performance. It was amazing! With Dead Rising, Capcom created a survival horror comedy beat-em up that had introduced RPG elements, photography, time, inventory, resource and human management. It's like, fuck, I can do whatever I want and there's so much to do! Sure, the sequels have opened up the playground, added more in-depth combat systems and packed it all to the brim with more zombies, but the original did it best. It's the simplicity of the gameplay and a variety of activities that helps Dead Rising age so finely, like a nice pack of smokes. 

	Now, old fans and new comers can enjoy this game without having to get an Xbox 360, A decision I was facing a few months before I discovered it's release on Steam. And it runs like my frozen dinner into the toilet. Smooth. Now, if only we can get Saints Row, Conker Live and Reloaded with Halo 2, I might just make myself some bathtub Gamer Fuel. Code Red y'all! Red allert! You gotta pick this up if you're on the fence. It's well worth the twenty bucks. It'll make you laugh, then piss you off, but don't take it too seriously. This game sure as fuck doesn't. Enjoy yourself at Willamette.

28034933.review:
Наверно самая лучшая часть из серии Dead Rising! Как ни странно, но у Capcom получился очень даже хороший порт игры. Стабильные 60fps, очень даже приятная на вид графика (на мой взгляд, текстуры и детали игры выглядят сочнее чем в DR2), так же вполне удобное управление. Хочу заметить, увеличение "слотов сохранения" до 5, что немаловажно и намного удобнее чем один, как это было на xbox версии 2006 года. Но опять же, если с портированием игры всё отлично, то с багами игры разработчики так и не справились. Все они перехали с консольной версии на пк, будто Capcom даже ничего и не проверяли, просто тупо перенесли игру. 
Примеры багов: (Джип с заключенными постоянно респаунится после 12 ночи каждого дня; игра подвисает на доли секунды после ударов по зомби некоторыми предметами (труба, кувалда, гитара); уровень интелекта выживших просто на нуле, при сопровождении в убежище, стоит чуть ускориться и оставить бота сзади, его сразу же закусает толпа зомби, приходиться постоянно следить и "расчищать" им путь; в режиме выживания, игра зависнет на загрузочном экране если войти в локацию Food Court в момент времени с 4-го по 5-й день.
Скажу в целом, DR это очень интересная игра, я бы даже сказал отличная, которая так же идеально портирована.

Из плюсов:
- Отличный сюжет.
- Графическая составляющая моделей персонажей и их детализация.
- Удобное управление.
- Гора трупов и гнилого мяса!

Из минусов:
- Все баги игры перенесены с xbox 360.
- Нереально тупые NPC!

8 фотографий Фрэнка из 10.

27404538.review:
Dead Rising is a series of zombie survival horror beat 'em up video games set in an open world created by Keiji Inafune. It was originally developed by Capcom until Blue Castle Games took over developing the franchise.

Graphics- Back in 2006 the graphics for this game were amazing but they have not aged well at all. I personally do not mind graphics as much as I know other people do so this is not a major setback

Story- The story is one of the strong points of this game. It is very good and has lots of amazing plot twists that you will not see coming but it does not do too much. It finds a balence between plot twists and realistic moments to create a very immersive experience.

combat- the combat is very fun but can be a bit glitchy with zombies. the combat is very varied due to the plethora of weapons at your disposale. the psychopath fights are arguable what made dead rising famous and this game really shows why! The fights are so much fun and each boss has their own special weakness you need to single out in order to secure the victory.

Characters-the characters are very well made. Capcom makes you care about what happens to the characters. I think by far the best characters are the psychopaths because they are so unique and have such great character devolopment even though you only meet them for a brief time.

Psychopaths- the psychopaths are great in this game with great storys behind why they are doing what they are doing. In my opinion these are the best psychopaths in the dead rising franchise. From cult leaders to clowns, this game truly has everything you could want from boss fights.

Survivors- The survivors are very good character wise. You can see why they are doing what they are or why they were at the mall but the guide system is a bit buggy and glitchy and the survivors are very slow but after 10 years I personally have grown acustom to it and just see it as another thing to make the game difficult. So Capcom, bring it on!

Soundtrack- the soundtrack is amazing in this game and has a huge variety for different moments. I think the best music stems from the psycho fights. the pyschos all have amazing songs that suit them perfectly. you really can tell a lot of time and effort went into the soudtrack and it shows!

difficulty- the game is just as difficult as it was ten years ago and for me personally I love that! It should not change. The game is hard but not too hard. it is not dark souls it is just hard by nature. I do like to be op and kill everyone but sometimes a bit of difficulty is a great thing.

Overall, this game has stood the test of time and is still one of the best games on steam and if you have not already I highly reccomend you snatch it up in the autumn or christmas sales! I would give this classic a 8.9/10. It could be better with certain bugs and glitches that can annoy the player but mostly it hits the nail on the hammer.

27147361.review:
This is a game from 2006, which doesn't force you to play the main story, or the side objectives. 
The main mode ends after 6 hours, and which ending you get is up to you, with and extra two hour long mode for getting ending A.

The textures have surely aged and the facial animations looked a bit wonky back then as well, but some modern resolution, AA and texture filtering have helped with keeping it presentable.

It had cosmetic DLC on the original which are a bunch of extra outfits for your playable character, which are all included for free.
Several achievements are tied to unlockable outfits and two super weapons.

The game is ideally played blind on a first playthrough, with some guide assistance on tricky achievements(no shame on looking up the PP stickers).

Trying to push through a zombie horde while trying to keep a cripple or two dead weights alive can mean death and being sent back several hours if you haven't saved recently.


I recommend this game if you are the kind of player that can appreciate being harshly punished for not taking precautions when going into danger.

26999190.review:
Dead Rising was one of the first games I ever played on my older cousin's Xbox 360 back in 2006. I remember playing it and immediately falling in love with the game; running around and hitting zombies and kicking the soccer ball at them always filled me with joy. 

Cut to about a year later and I got my very own Xbox 360 and this was the very first game I bought. I spent hundreds of hours on my Xbox, playing this game and enjoying the everliving hell out of it. Over time, my Xbox died out and I wasn't able to play the game anymore as getting any game to run on that Xbox was just a nightmare to run, and eventually I moved over to Playstation and PC, and it was a long while since I had played it.

Then I see that Dead Rising was being remastered for the PC and now it's here. It's still just as amazing as I remembered it and it was great to begin playing it again from the start and rexperiencing everything that I did almost 10 years ago. Now, it's not a perfect game. There's plenty of little issues with the game (the AI companions, the shooting mechanics, etc), but the remaster kept all of those features just like how they were in the old games, which is one of the nice things of a remaster; giving the game a fresh look but keeping the exact same feel.

The port runs very well for me with little to no issues and I've had a blast playing it. If you've never been able to play it before, I highly recommend picking it up when you can, becuase it is a gem of a game to play through and is the best one in the series in my opinion; and always will hold a special place in my heart for me.

26410387.review:
It's great to see the game available after being an exclusive for the Xbox 360 for ten years. I couldn't recommend this game any more than I already do, perhaps it's the nostalgia talking, but Dead Rising blew my mind back when I first saw gameplay of it and still holds up as an incredibly fun zombie game. Dead Rising has a pretty good storyline with it's fair share of intentionally cheesy moments, with over-the-top gameplay that was just right.

The game has a lot of extra features, weapons and costumes to keep you going, giving plenty of incentive to keep going - from defeating a number of psychopaths, saving an amount of survivors to killing a towns population worth of undead. You're left with an entire mall of activities to get up to, with plenty of side quests and side bosses to fight whilst waiting for the next scoop. 

The gameplay is challenging and can be very unforgiving for a new player, but once you get the hang of things you'll be taking down zombies by the hundreds. My only complaint comes with the infuriating AI of survivors, escorting them can be hell at times, but if you power through it you should be okay. 

In conclusion, it's one of my favourite titles and I'd definitely recommend picking it up, it's optimised well and is a ton of fun.

26380128.review:
Dead Rising is my absolute favorite game. I love the humor, the whimsy, the silliness but also the story, the gameplay, and while it's much easier on PC with the multiple save slots, I even enjoyed the difficulty of the 360 version back in 2006. It was unapologetically and unforgetably unique. And I believe it's safe to say that it still is. 

By todays standard, zombie games are a dime a dozen. Literally during some Steam Sales. But Dead Rising still stands out. It offers a huge playground full of enemies, a simply insane number of items and systems you can use to fight those enemies, and an entertaining story to tie it all together. 

Freelance Photojournalist Frank West is on a mission to find a story he can document and report on. His leads send him to Willamette Colorado to uncover why there is a freeze on information coming out after reports of civil unrest. Upon his arrival, he finds that this is no riot, but an outbreak of zombies unlike anything the world has known... or so he believes. As the story progresses you'll learn the major players, where the zombie virus originates, and how it found its way to this small Colorado town. And you'll have to do so while battling with a unique set of villains, labeled "Psychopaths' in the game, who will work to thwart your attempts to uncover THE FACTS at all costs. 

If you were a fan of the 360 version, this new PC release is better than ever. It fixes many of the major complaints from the 2006 release. Namely the load times are now tolerable where once they were unbearable and you also now have 5 save slots rather than the original 1. The game looks great considering it's age and it plays as well as ever. Tight controls and a system for upgrading unlike any you've played before. You may start out as a lowly photographer with a gut and a bulbous nose, but by the time you reach level 50 Frank has essentially become a zombie killing machine with ninja reflexes and speed to match. Fight zombies and Psychopaths with anything you can pick up, and you can pick up almost everything, or use your bare hands as your skills moves fill out over the course of leveling up. 

For those who never played Dead Rising back when it was a new game, you should consider picking this game up and get ready for a treat! Admittedly though, as I said in the opening of this review, I am a full blown fan. I'd never pretend that this is a perfect game because it does have it's flaws, but they are minor and in this new PC release many of the old complaints have been fixed completely. 

Consider giving this one a try! I don't think you'll be disappointed. :)

Le niveau du portage est très bon niveau performances, j'ai vu peu de gens s'en plaindre et sur mes deux ordinateurs, ils tournent avec tout à fond en 60fps constant (I5/970 et I5/1070 pour les deux).

Par rapport au jeu, je les ai fait dans le désordre (d'abord les deux DLC de Dead Rising 2 sur XBOX 360 en co-op, Dead Rising 2 Off The Record en co-op, Dead Rising 3 seul puis en co-op et enfin j'ai terminé par le premier Dead Rising) mais je comprends évidemment mieux pourquoi le premier est le préféré de la plupart des joueurs.

Rien que la limite de temps très tendue (par rapport aux autres épisodes) rend le jeu plus intéressant car elle force à faire de nombreux choix (j'ai donc fait le choix, lors de ma première partie, de juste essayer de finir le jeu sans m'occuper de tous les psychopathes optionnels).

Le jeu est évidemment bien plus dur que les 2 et 3, je suis mort pas mal de fois à la fin (même si on ne meurt pas vraiment, on se fait juste capturer temporairement). On voit bien que le jeu n'est pas vraiment fait pour le finir dès sa première partie, car on finit environ au niveau 20 et c'est assez limite pour certains psychopathes (sauf si on s'autorise à utiliser la mini-tronçonneuse qui est juste trop puissante par rapport aux autres armes).

Pour le mode extra, j'ai par contre fait l'erreur d'éteindre après la sauvegarde automatique. Je pensais que ça conserverait mon inventaire mais contrairement aux sauvegardes automatiques précédentes, celle au début du mode extra retire les objets, ce qui complique grandement la mission suivante.

Bref, j'en garde un très bon souvenir et je referais une nouvelle partie sous peu, histoire de vaincre tous les psychopathes que j'ai esquivé et probablement débloquer ce qu'il y a à débloquer.

26282363.review:
The TRUE zombie survival experience.

My history with Dead Rising is an odd one. While I never owned an Xbox 360, I did watch a 100% let's play of it (Shouts out to OatmealRaisin). So my perspective with the game is different than someone going into it blind.

Since I had seen the Let's play years ago, while I didn't fully remember all the details I knew a general plan of what to do. So while this was my first time playing the game for real, I was able to get the true ending in my first playthrough. 

Now if you've never played Dead Rising before, or don't even know what you do in the game it's simple: 
You’re in a mall with zombies and you either do missions or mess around killing zombies. But why is there the reputation of the game being confusing or overly difficult to beat? Well it has to do with the time mechanic.

There is an in-game timer, counting down for the end of the game. Missions as well have a time limit to them and appear at specific times. Sometimes there’s even hidden missions at certain times you'll most likely miss too. This whole timing mechanic adds stress and tension onto the player to get their shit done quick. For people who want a pleasant sandbox stroll through a mall this is the turn off for the game, but the timer is what makes the game special from any other zombie game. Sure the zombie horde isn't too much of a threat to you, but if you want to save all survivors especially during some clutch situations than may lady luck be on your side. Cus the timer will show you that there are no heroes in a zombie apocalypse, unless they are in megaman armor.

But the survivor AI can be annoying. They will go to waypoints pretty well, and they can handle themselves when they have a good weapon, but they can freak out to a frustrating degree if they are following you.

The tone of the game is very Japanese. Meaning while there's really weird dumb humor and dialogue, everything is treated seriously. Which in turn makes it pretty funny. I think it's a fine enough middle ground, allowing the player to say be in their underwear during cutscenes if they really want to. 

The size of the mall isn't actually that big. It may feel big at the start when you are at LVL1 meaning your walk speed is slow (yes, there is no sprint in the game unfortunately, but there are some alternatives) and you have no shortcuts, but once you learn the layout it's pretty easy to get around. Since it was the first console game to be a sandbox game with like 50 NPCs on screen at once, some sacrifices had to be made. While there are a couple unique landmark shops, in general the stores are tiny and have a couple items lying around. It makes exploring the landscape alone not that exciting cus it can feel samey, but technically they do want you to find hidden items and missions instead.

Dead Rising, while old console gen-wise, gives a zombie survival experience you can't really get anywhere else. 

PC PORT REPORT: Runs fine. It looks like a 360 game, and that is what you’re getting. An "issue" you may face is when you hit stuff with a blunt weapon there is "hitlag". AKA The game will appear to freeze for a moment, looking like the game is stuttering when on contact. This is an intentional feature of the game and was in the original as well. I'm hoping for a patch that'll give an option to turn it off, but honestly it's probably the biggest downside to the game.

GENERAL TIPS AND ADVICE:
*USE THE WAYPOINTS FOR SURVIVORS! Put a waypoint at whatever door your heading to and they'll actually be able to navigate through the zombies.
*Survivors have infinite ammo so, especially if you're trying to move a big crew, give them some guns. 
*Make sure to do the Out of Control scoop. The rewards are invaluable. 
*Colombian Roastmasters has infinite orange juice, stock up!
*Servbot mask = epic cutscenes.

26212097.review:
軍によって封鎖された特産物もない田舎町ウィラメッテ。町の暴動スクープを手にするため空からウィラメッテに侵入したフリージャーナリストのフランク・ウェスト。ひときわ目立つ巨大ショッピングモールに降り立つも、目の当たりにしたのは暴徒化した人々ではなく…ゾンビであった。閉ざされてた出入り口であったが、ある人の行動によってゾンビの群衆が雪崩れ込んできた

まさか360以外で1作目がやれる日が来るとは夢にも思わなかった。1080p60fpsにリマスターされ、ロード時間短縮、日本語対応かつ稲シップによって自主規制されたゴア描写は解禁されてる。日本版360版の規制でガッカリされ海外版を購入した人は多くいたはずだ。ゾンビが欠損しないなんておかしいよね?

モール内はゾンビだらけで、その光景はジョージ・A・ロメロの『ゾンビ』をまさにゲーム化したかのような感じだ(そっくりなせいで映画会社が申し立てて裁判になりかけたことが)
72時間後に迎えのヘリが来るまではモール内を自由に移動して、事件の真相を追ったり逃げ遅れた人を救助する内容だけど、それを放ったからしてゾンビを殺しまくるのもあり。各CASEごと時間制限があってそれを過ぎてしまうとゲームオーバーとなるが、ストーリーを無視してゲームを続けることができる

使える物は全て武器となる。刃物、銃、木材、マネキン、植木鉢、ベンチ、ジュース缶、CD、皿、鮭、数え切れないくらいある
食える物や飲める物も全て回復アイテムとなる。スナック菓子、ワイン、果物、野菜、牛乳、ピザ、生肉、こちらもまだまだある。腐ったものも食えるがお腹を壊してしまう。ミキサーで混ぜ合わせて出来たミックスジュースは一時的にフランクが早く走れたり、吐き出す唾がハンドガンの弾の如く威力が上がったりと特殊な能力が得られる。ただし漆黒のミックスジュースはお腹を壊すだけとなる

ゾンビ以外にも騒ぎで理性を失ったサイコパスが存在する
事情があるにしろ口だけでは止められない人間となってしまってる。特にピエロ、あんただけは群を抜いて一番やばい(死に方も)

最初こそはフランクは弱くて足が遅いのでサイコパスとの戦闘や救助に苦労はするけど、ゾンビを倒す、救助者をセーフルームまで誘導する、写真を撮ったりして経験値が得られレベルが上がればフランクは強くなりサマーソルトキックや内臓抜きを覚えたりと次第に人間離れしたフランクとなる。レベルを引き継いで周回プレイも可能なので、難しいと思ったら強くてニューゲームする手もある

一番の問題点である救助者のアホAIは直ってません。気のせいか360版より悪くなってるような…。どんなに「来い!」「行け!」と指示しても近くにいるゾンビに攻撃して返り討ちに遭ったりとストレスゲージが急上昇。ゾンビの餌食になってもプレイヤーの責任ではないので…

26183580.review:
I originally had Dead Rising for the xbox360 and I really enjoyed my time with it, needles to say I bought it as soon as I heard it came out for PC.
The beginning of Dead Rising is quite punishing but gets more fun the more time passes.
The game has a really strict time schedule meaning that every specific time a story elements happens if your not at the designated area at the specific time you ruin the entire story and cant get the good ending anymore.
Being that Dead Rising is a semi-open world game, some people could really dislike this, I thought it was pretty interesting but also restricts you from exploring the world.
Having said that, it's a really enjoyable game with smooth controls.

26177938.review:
Lets look at dead rising 1. I will talk about the pros and cons of the game and finish with my conclusion.

Pro:
     Its a sandbox game in the mall. I really like that idea because it reminds me of the old dawn of the dead movie, a classic. Actually funny thing is the developers had to mention that the game was not ripping off or copying the movie....something like that.

      Anything can be a weapon. A plant is a weapon, boxes, advertisement stands, frying pans, Litterally anything can be used as a weapon to fend off the zombies. Alot can be classified as useless but nothings funnier than using a toy laser sword to fight zombies.

       Great story. I enjoyed how the story played out and the characters dialog. It was nice and classic.

       Rpg elements. So the more you do in the game the stronger you get. This opens up more replayability. You get exp or what this game calls perstige points (PP) from doing tasks like killing zombies, saving survivors, and killing bosses.

       The music is nice. Dont know what i can say about it though.
       
Con:
       Clunky controls. Even using a controller the game feels clunky. Aiming is with the right stick, aim with LT. Things just felt awkward. Not to mention the special moves frank can use. Yes you will see press A and X at the same time quite often. Thats an issue because A is to jump and X is to attack. Most of the time when i try to do the sumersalt kick i end up doing a jump kick. Its hard to get fully into the game when i have to fight the controls to do more stronger hand to hand attacks or even aiming.

        AI are really dumb. The survivors tend to fight all the zombies or get stun locked so easily. Its frustrating for reasons i will explain in my conclusion.

       AI navigation is poor. Alot of time when trying to move 3 or more survivors there navigations get messed up....really bad. I had to sit there and watch 3 survivors try and jump over the counter in the gun shop....they couldnt even do that. I had to see 5 survivors trying to jump onto the concrete slab near the air vent. It took 20mins for one to get on. Sometimes the survivors just stand there for some odd reason even though i am shouting at them to move. They only get out if I do damage to them. Sometimes that doesnt even fix the issue which means i have to kill them.

       Survivor death cutscene. Ok it was cool the first time but it gets annoying when they die from being just bad. It breaks the flow of the game and really kills my mood to continue. Its like the game is rubbing salt in the wound that i messed up and should of protected the survivor better. I would if they could protect themselves when they have a weapon like a shotgun. With a shotgun the AI should never be stun locked.

        Respawning psychopaths. Not all are bad but the prisoners are the worst. They spawn back and normally thats when i am trying to move a survivor to the safehouse. Its annoying having to deal with them.

       Player stun lock. Yes there are points that you can get stun locked super easily. I got stun locked when in the maintence tunnel doing the bomb mission. Carlito was running me over constantly that i couldnt do anything. Thats fair.

        Bad achievements. Why is there an achievement to save 50 survivors that is very up tight for a game with poor maintence like this. You have to be pretty perfect to get the achievement and that is no fun.

        Zombie spawns are bad. The zombies spawn when you walk roughly like 15 ft from the end of the spawn zone. Got to love the moments where you accidentally spawn a horde of zombies on a survivor just because you were too far.

        Zombie ammounts during night time parts are just tedius. Not only do you have agressive zombies but a tone to deal with. Normally you get missions that net you a large number of survivors to save during these parts. Always fun to slowly kill your way through a ton of zombies with clunky controls.

Conclusion:
         Dead rising isnt a bad game but here being some number of years after its original release. It is sad how clunky it is. You play something like DR2 or DR3 and they are more mechanically sound with the combat. What makes me sad is that i played DR1 on the WII and people swear up and down the streets that the WII port was the worst. Sadly they are wrong, in the WII version the AI was competent, the zombies didnt respawn in mass because i ran out of their spawn zone by 15 ft. I actually dont remember if they respawn when in that section of the map after killing them all. The controls for the WII version was simply amazing, i didnt struggle to do the special moves at all. In turn can I say I enjoyed the game....NO but thankful for the chance to play the original version. Massively dissapointed how poor the game is when they could of fixed the issues, its been over 10 years I think so I wouldnt believe it would be too much to ask to make the HD remaster of the game play better than slap on an HD coat of paint and call it a day. Can i reccomend this game....NO rather buy DR3 i loved that game and played DR off the record on PS3 and enjoyed it. Dont know if i will do off the record on steam since no controller support. If you want to do DR1 wait for a sale or play the WII version. It is better and i find more enjoyment for that version.

26042733.review:
Steam版デッドライジング2配信からおよそ6年・・・
ついに初代デッドライジングがSteamで配信されました。

ジャーナリストのおっさんがカメラ片手にゾンビまみれのショッピングモールを潜入取材(物理)するアクションゲームです。
与えられた時間は3日間で、その間にモール内を自由に散策できます。
ゾンビまみれのモール内、取り残された生存者達。もちろん何も起きないはずがなく・・・ストーリーを追っていくことになるでしょう。

以下、(主にDR2と比較した)評価です。
良い点
・ストーリーに縛られない自由行動ができること
一部例外はありますが、メインストーリーが失敗してもゲームオーバーにはならず続行可能となります。
その間に飽きるまでゾンビ無双をするもよし、通常プレイではとれないような実績を取得するもよし、
生存者を助けて2週目に向けたレベル上げもよし、モールの雰囲気を楽しむもよし・・・
楽しみ方はプレイヤー次第です。

悪い点
・生存者が軒並み弱いこと
生存者には強気・弱気の2種類の性格があり、弱気の生存者はゾンビに掴まりやすいので目を離すとすぐに体力を削られやられてしまいます。
フランクさんのレベルが低い場合、ゾンビに掴まった生存者を助けようとして逆に自分がゾンビに殴られ掴まれゲームオーバーになる・・・なんてことも。
続編(DR2)の生存者達が強すぎるのは、これに不満をもったプレイヤーが少なからずいたことが理由だと思いました。

・生存者のAIがアホなこと
生存者の一つ一つの行動が酷くて、プレイヤーを苛立たせます。
壁に向かって走り続けるわ、店の隙間に挟まるわ、他の生存者を押しのけて走るわ・・・
タイムリミットが迫ってるダクト前は特にイライラすること間違いなし！
生存者がパニックしていると脳内補完すれば多少なら許せるかもしれません。

生存者のアホさ加減が目立ちましたが、それでも「初代DRが一番面白い」と言われるだけあって非常に面白かったです。
XBOXコントローラーにも対応しているので、キーボード操作に慣れない方は是非こちらを推奨します。
DR2・OTRしかやったことない人、初めてデッドライジングをやる人にもおすすめできるゲームです。

The very first game I played on 360. I would recommend it to anyone.

One thing to note though is that the game can be unforgiving to lower level and inexperienced players. The AI is not always great, and it can be a nightmare escorting survivors through a crowd of zombies because you constantly have to get a zombie off someone that was caught by one only for it to happen right again immediately after. It's insane when you have more than 3.

The psychopaths can be brutal, but once you figure out their pattern, it is not too bad. Once you max out damage, you'll be blasting through them. 

2, its DLC, and 3 fixed most of the issues in 1, but coming from one of those to 1 can be a bit of a jump.

In conclusion, the game can be enjoyable and, once you get the hang of it, it can be pretty good.

If you have an extra 20 bucks, I say give it a try.

25988925.review:
Dead Rising... where to even begin with this game. Well, let's start with how I originally played it. I first played this game on the xbox 360 7-8 years ago and I absolutely loved it... but I was always too afraid to do anything in the game for some odd reason so I never got past backup for brad. The zombies were fun to kill, the environment was fun to explore and the psychopaths scared the crap out of me. I played this game for hours upon hours just staying in the first part of the mall killing zombies and even doing just that; this game was entertaining and very fun to play

Now fast forward to present time. When I heard this game was being ported to PC I was friggin HYPED. I didn't preorder it but I did buy it a day or two later after it's release. I must admit, I was a bit skeptical of a port for a game this old with it also being an exclusive for the 360. But boy, I have never felt happier to be wrong. This game does NOT feel like a port from the 360, it feels like something that was meant for PC all along. The game handles great, the graphics still hold up and I haven't crashed a single time. Unlike the young and afraid pony that used to play this game, I was able to beat the game and enjoy it and BOY did I miss out. The story was wonderful, the character development was perfect and the psychopaths... still scared the crap out of me. This game has a hair pulling amount of challenge to it and that's another reason I love it; this game does NOT hold your hand much, unlike a lot of modern games, so if you're not up for a fun challenge and don't want to be pulling out your own hair at times, then you should stay away from this game and if you do play it, remember to save frequently! Because getting your face nommed off or getting wrecked by a psychopath and then having to go back because you forgot to save is never fun. (trust me) 

Now while this port is excellently delivered the cons from the original version still stick out like: The A.I that feels the necessity to run up to zombies that aren't even posing much of a threat and fight them, thus getting crowded by like sixty of them, resulting in you having to waste time and resource to help them.

And the BANE of my playthrough, which is still about the A.I: The friggin hand holding. Yeah, that may sound stupid to anyone who hasn't played this game before, but once you try guiding one of the survivors back to safety and you have to hold their hand, you'll understand soon enough. I don't know how many times I had to scream at my monitor because they suddenly just let go of my hand and then got crowded by zombies. It's an annoying aspect that you can get around if you don't have a heart for fellow survivors! But you can't avoid it forever.

All in all this game is and will always be magnificent and at the top of my favorite games list. I completely recommend it to anyone who hasn't played it before and to the people who have played it on the 360 but may be a bit skeptical to buy it. This is definitely worth the price, so get it, have fun and remember to drink your mixed juice!

This game is FAN-TASTIC!

25971928.review:
RESUMEN: FRANK WEST = 9,5/10

Como fan indiscutible del Amanecer de los muertos de George A Romero (1978) y de los zombies en general, Dead Rising es una delicia tochísima muchos niveles, que todo fan del genero tendría que experimentar almenos una vez. La película original es una obra maestra con una gran crítica al consumismo (zombies en un centro comercial, guiados por un impulso, un recuerdo de su anterior vida) y este juego es un homenaje brutal a esto y mucho más. Si nunca habeis visto esta película, debeis, las similitudes son muy claras y se agradecen ya que todo el juego es un homenaje a la misma con su toque personal (Por cierto, debe ser una de las únicas pelis de terror donde el negro se salva de verdad, sin pegas).

Pensemos en la situación, apostados en un centro comercial... Una manada de zombies se aglutina en las puertas; Debido a alguna especie de impulso o antiguo recuerdo/instinto, estos no muertos aún recuerdan el centro comercial de su pequeña localidad como algo importante en sus vidas, un lugar donde pasaban mucho tiempo y que estaba lleno de personas. Por desgracia los últimos supervivientes de la matanza en el pueblo de Willamette (Ahora totalmente acordonado por la guardia nacional y el ejercito) pensaron lo mismo y se han atrincherado en el mismo. Frank West es un reportero de primera línea y cree que su contacto puede haberle dado la exclusiva de su vida, decide así ir a la pequeña ciudad para cubrir un supuesto "disturbio" generalizado; El lado bueno es que Frank va a conseguir la exclusiva de su vida... el malo es que el no pensaba que estaría todo lleno de "zombies"... Frank tiene 3 días para descubrir como se inició la infección y cubrir la noticia, hasta que le recoja el helicoptero el último día. Por el camino, salvarás supervivientes, descubrirás la verdad, segarás zombies con un cortacésped y razonarás con payasos psicópatas. Realmente este juego, incluso tratando sobre zombies hacia cosas de una forma muy distinta a los demás pudiendo utilizar multitud de cosas como arma y teniendo muchos retos que afrontar dentro del mismo ( Vigila el tiempo !); Además el juego cuenta con multitud de finales y es bastante rejugable.

En 2006 no había nada como Dead Rising y aún en 2016 sigue siendo un juego que se siente bastante innovador en un género muy saturado, recuerdo ver la carátula del mismo año de su lanzamiento y flipar en colores con la cantidad de zombies; El juego sigue luciendo muy decente en 1080 y a 60 fps y desprende una atmosfera cuidada por cada uno de sus lados, desde la música relajante en las tiendas mientras los zombies andan por el centro comercial, hasta el TEMAZO del combate con los presos. Sin duda para mí es el mejor Dead Rising.

25956688.review:
I've played loads of hours on 360 years ago and came back to an experience just as fresh as I remember playing the demo from Xbox Live. 

- classic dumb shamble zombies
- real time and completely optional story-line
- multiple endings
- campy dialogue
- quality voice acting and motion capture
- impressive character textures
- time management gameplay that prepared me for college
- visual design that has stood the test of time
- atmospheric with a solid variety of locations
- old school save system 
- fantastic optimization
- load points are frequent but load times are practically nil
- photography mechanics are fun
- signature Capcom inventory management madness
- plenty of typical and atypical weapons to choose from
- ridiculous costumes carry over into cutscenes for absolute lunacy
- bursting to the seams with classic influences and homages
- salacious Japanese humor is unbridled 
- pointed and irreverent jabs at American culture
- full mouse and keyboard functionality but some awkward menu controls
- hair-splittingly terrible A.I. decision-making and pathing
- high replay value
- psychopath encounters are entertaining

There are few games I recommend as highly as Dead Rising.

25941625.review:
Finalmente è uscito su PC, e non ha alcun difetto oppure problemi di ottimizzazione , il gioco gira a 60 FPS e ha avuto alcuni problemi tecnici che sono stati risolti per esempio problemi con i salvataggi in cui veniva danneggiati senza motivo (io per fortuna non ho incontrato) e ha anche Textures rifatte bene, il gioco mi era sempre piaciuto per la location che aveva visto che ha preso ispirazione dal film "Zombi (1978)" di George Romero (Gran film!), mi ne ero innamorato ma purtroppo era uscito su X360 ma adesso che l'ho giocato posso considerare il migliore e il più difficile di tutti i Dead Rising. 

Il gioco è abbastanza difficile (sono morto un bel pò di volte) perchè i Zombie sono molto aggressivi in questo capitolo (peccato che questa aggressività su Dead Rising 2 è assente), e quindi per muoverti devi essere abbastanza attento, e fanno anche un danno alto, compresi i psicopatici e militari, il tempo è la "chicca" del gioco (che molti detestano ma io onestamente l'amo), e bisogna non perdere tempo e aiutare gli altri superstiti e scortarli (molto difficile a farlo visto che IA dei sopravvissuti è abbastanza stupida) nella Safe House e così guadagnare Punti Potenza facendo crescere Frank ([b]Consiglio:[/b] Fate in modo di scortare alla Safe House il più possibile dei superstiti perchè così facendo Frank crescerà e diventare forte, visto che all'inizio è debole, ovviamente uccidete anche molti Zombie e sopratutto i Psicopatici, io con la prima run sono riuscito a scortare tutti i superstiti del gioco, ho fatto una faticaccia assurda!)

Come Longevità è ottima sopratutto per chi non conosce le meccaniche di gioco, e quindi dovrà imparare a gestire il tempo, la Storia è stupenda per me, come ho detto è il migliore Dead Rising. 

Pro:

+ 60 FPS
+ Textures in alta risoluzione 
+ Elevate Risoluzioni 
+ Suono
+ Storia
+ Location
+ Longevità (15-20 ore per i meno esperti)

Con:

- IA dei superstiti

25886190.review:
El primer Dead Rising, estrenado en 2006 como exclusivo de Xbox, hace su aparicion en PC despues de 10 años.

Dead Rising, un juego que ofrecio una innovacion en cuanto a jugabilidad, en donde el jugador tenia un acceso al entorno mucho mejor, en donde cualquier objeto llegaba a ser un item utilizable.

Presentandonos ademas al fan-tastico Frank West! El protagonista quien es un periodista-fotografo freelance que no tiene mejor idea que meterse a un centro comercial despues de que este haya sido limitado en su territorio por la Guardia Nacional yankee! De locos

Ademas, ofrece una historia de zombis interesante con una pizca de conspiraciones guvernamentales y un humor un tanto extraño -la clasica-, en donde el juego no se toma asi mismo, pero aun asi logra darnos un contexto profundo.

Super bien optimizado, y con graficos remasterizados, sin nada mas que decir, en mi opinion y dados los argumentos de una corta revision, es 10/10! Ya que Capcom en su aniversario por 10 años de Dead Rising, nos trae esta joya de Xbox a los jugadores de PC, con el mismo valor de jugabilidad de aquella vez

25883295.review:
First of all let me say I'm a huge fan of the Dead Rising Series and I'm very much looking forward to number 4. I've played all 3 and this is probably my favorite of the three. That said this game takes some serious dedication to complete. You are the original protagonist Frank West and you get choppered into Willamette Colorado where a zombie outbreak has just taken place. Some things right off the bat, there are no combo weapons in this game like the others so if you played 2 and 3 before this, then you might be a little disappointed at first. Other than that, almost all the items in the game you will recognize and you can still craft beverages and you must rely more heavily on the hand to hand combat system in certain boss battles. 

Some key points: 
1. Don't worry about completing all the cases on your first playthrough, feel free to explore and familiarize yourself with the ins and outs of the game. 
2. Go to the maintenance tunnels early through Leisure Park 
3. Do take out the convicts at least once so you can get the enjoyment of the heavy machine gun. This is best done from afar with the sniper rifle. 
4. Make sure you take lots of pictures and change batteries often as this will help with prestige points, and get the photography book in paradise plaza bookstore because it will help with taking the most valuable pictures
5. Once you level up your inventory space, you'll be able to carry more books especially the health ones, criminal biography, and skateboarding
6. Get the mini chainsaw no matter what from the Adam the clown battle
7. Take a picture of the air ducts at the security room because you'll need that later to give to the survivors who take over the hunting shack in the north plaza. 
8. To get the Mega Blaster, grab a car in the maintenance tunnels and spend some time mowing down zombies. 
9. Be careful where you leave your survivors. 
10. Go to Rippers Blades and get katanas and broadswords until you can get the more powerful melee weapons. 
11. Keep some sort of health on you at all times, this is vital once you unlock infinity mode. 

Overall great game and it took way too long to get to Steam. I'm still working on 100% but will update this review later.
